SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT THIS SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT (this Agreement) is made as of July 25, 2025 (the Effective Date), by and between NEVADA COGENERATION ASSOCIATES #2, a Utah partnership, in its individual capacity (NCA2) and in its capacity as Manager hereunder, and PANWEST NCA2 SOLAR LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (Panwest). NCA2 and Panwest are collectively referred to herein as the Project Companies and each individually as a Project Company. The Project Companies, together with the Manager, are collectively referred to herein as the Parties and individually as a Party. The term Party shall include the permitted successors and permitted assignees of such Person. Certain capitalized terms used in this Agreement are defined in Appendix A attached hereto. RECITALS A. NCA2 (as successor-in-interest to Bonneville Nevada Corporation, a Nevada corporation), in its capacity as Lessee, and Pacific Coast Building Products, Inc., a California corporation (Pacific Coast), in its capacity as Lessor, entered into that certain Ground Lease PABCO Cogeneration project, dated May 1, 1989 and recorded in the Official Records of Clark County (Official Records) on June 18,1991 in Book 910618 and Inst. 00330, as amended by that certain First Amendment to Ground Lease dated June 19, 1991, as amended by that certain Second Amendment to Ground Lease dated August 1, 1991, and as amended by that certain Third Amendment to Ground Lease dated February 19, 2021 (collectively, the Thermal Lease), covering the lands more particularly described on Exhibit A-1 attached hereto (the NCA2 Property). NCA2 operates an 85 MW combined-cycle gas turbine facility on the NCA2 Property (the NCA2 Project). B. NCA2, in its capacity as grantee, is party to that certain Grant of Easement dated August 1, 1991 and recorded August 20, 1991, in Book 910820 as Document No. 00029, Official Records, as amended by that certain Partial Release of Easement, dated March 17, 2011 and recorded March 17, 2011 as Instrument No. 201103170003735, Official Records, and as further modified by that certain Addendum to Grant of Easement and Designation of Encumbered Portions of Burdened Parcel, dated October 04, 2011, and recorded on October 06, 2011 as Instrument No. 20111060001951, Official Records (as amended, the Grant of Easement) pursuant to the which NCA2 holds certain non-exclusive easements in, upon and over certain real property legally described in the Grant of Easement which, among other things, provides NCA2 with access to the NCA2 Substation Premises (as hereinafter defined). C. Panwest (as successor-in-interest to NCA2), in its capacity as Tenant, and PABCO Building Products, LLC, a Nevada limited liability company (PABCO), in its capacity as Landlord, entered into that certain Solar Generating Facility Land Option and Lease and Easement Agreement, dated February 19, 2021, as amended by that certain First Amendment to Solar Generating Facility Land Option and Lease and Easement Agreement, dated July 19, 2022, as assigned by that certain Assignment and Assumption Agreement, dated July 19, 2022, and as amended by that certain Second Amendment to Solar Generating Facility Land Option and Lease and Easement Agreement, dated September 30, 2024 (collectively, the Solar Lease) granting Panwest the option to lease certain land more particularly described on Exhibit A-2 attached hereto 4919-2205-6789.1
(the Panwest Property). Panwest intends to develop a 57 MW solar energy generation project and 228 MWh battery storage project on the Panwest Property (the Panwest Project). D. The NCA2 Project and the Panwest Project are individually referred to herein as a Project, and collectively as the Projects. The NCA2 Property and the Panwest Property are collectively referred to as the Properties and individually referred to as a Property. E. Panwest, as developer, and PABCO, as owner, are parties to that certain Grant of Electrical and Communication Line Easement Agreement, dated June 13, 2025, and recorded July 21, 2025, as Document No. 20250721-0000852 in the Official Records (the Gen-Tie Easement) pursuant to which Panwest holds certain real property rights covering lands which include the NCA2 Substation (the NCA2 Substation Premises), as depicted on Exhibit A-3 attached hereto. Pursuant to the Gen-Tie Easement, Panwest was granted rights to construct the Panwest Project Interconnection Improvements (as such term is hereinafter defined) within the NCA2 Substation Premises. As used in this Agreement, the term Panwest Project Interconnection Improvements shall mean facilities for the collection, distribution, step-up, step-down, wheeling, transportation and sale of electricity and for communications, including the following: underground and/or overhead distribution, collection and transmission lines; underground and/or overhead control, communications and radio relay systems and telecommunications equipment; interconnection and/or switching facilities, circuit breakers, transformers; cables, wires, fiber, conduit, footings, foundations, towers, poles, crossarms, guy lines and anchors, and any related or associated improvements, fixtures, facilities, appliances, machinery and equipment. F. NCA2 and Panwest are parties to that certain Crossing Agreement and Grant of Easement, dated October 23, 2023, and recorded October 26, 2023, as Document No.20231026-0001526 in the Official Records, as amended by Amendment to Crossing Agreement and Grant of Easement, dated July 26th, 2024, and recorded July 26, 2024, as Document No.20240726-0000802 om the Official Records, as affected by Amended and Restated Crossing Agreement, dated July 21, 2025, and recorded July 21, 2025, as Document No. 20250721-0001419 in the Official Records (the Crossing Agreement) pursuant to which NCA2 consented to construction of the Panwest Project Interconnection Improvements within the NCA2 Substation Premises and the use of such Panwest Project Interconnection Improvements within the NCA2 Substation Premises by Panwest. G. Panwest is a party to that certain First Amended and Restated Standard Large Generator Interconnection Agreement dated December 20, 2022 with Nevada Power Company d/b/a NV Energy (NVE) (as amended, the Panwest Interconnection Agreement), and which relates to the interconnection of the Panwest Project to the NVE controlled transmission system via the Point of Interconnection (as such term is defined in the Interconnection Agreement) located within the NCA2 Substation Premises. H. NCA2 owns, or has certain rights to use, the Shared Facilities (as hereinafter defined), and Panwest desires to utilize such Shared Facilities to deliver electricity produced by its Project from the Point of Interconnection to the Point of Change of Ownership (as such terms are defined in the Panwest Interconnection Agreement). Such real property underlying the Shared Facilities (i.e., the area from the Point of Interconnection to the Point of Change of Ownership 1 4919-2205-6789.1
located within the NCA2 Substation Premises) shall be referred to herein as the Shared Facilities Premises, as depicted on Exhibit A-4 attached hereto. J. NCA2 and Panwest wish to share the use and cost of certain electrical transmission, communications and other structures and facilities, including the Shared Facilities (as hereinafter defined), and to engage Manager to construct, operate, maintain, repair and manage the foregoing, all in accordance with and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing recitals, the mutual promises contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and adequacy of which are hereby acknowledged by the Parties, the Parties agree as follows: ARTICLE 1 DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATIONS 1.1 Definitions. As used in this Agreement, including the Recitals, and except as required by grammatical usage and apart from proper nouns, each capitalized term has the meaning given to it in this Agreement and in the Schedule of Definitions attached as Appendix A. 1.2 Interpretation. In this Agreement, unless a clear, contrary intention appears: (a) the singular includes the plural and vice versa; (b) reference to any Person includes such Persons successors and assigns but, in the case of a Project Company, only if such assigns are permitted by this Agreement, and reference to a Person in a particular capacity excludes such Person in any other capacity; (c) reference to any gender includes each other gender; (d) reference to any agreement (including this Agreement), document or instrument means such agreement, document or instrument as amended or modified and in effect from time to time in accordance with the terms thereof and, if applicable, the terms of this Agreement; (e) reference to any Governmental Requirement means such Governmental Requirement as amended, modified, codified, or reenacted, in whole or in part, and in effect from time to time, including, if applicable, rules and regulations promulgated thereunder; (f) reference to any Section means such Section of this Agreement, and references in any Section or definition to any clause means such clause of such Section or definition; (g) hereunder, hereof, hereto and words of similar import shall be deemed references to this Agreement as a whole and not to any particular Section or other provision of this Agreement; (h) including means including without limiting the generality of any description such term; and (i) relative to the determination of any period of time, from means from and including, to means to but excluding and through means through and including. ARTICLE 2 SHARED FACILITIES 2.1 NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights. (a) The NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights are described on Exhibit B. The NCA2 Substation Property Rights allow or will allow for the development, design, construction, Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities. 2 4919-2205-6789.1
(b) Panwest has or will obtain from PABCO, as fee owner of the NCA2 Substation Premises, the Gen-Tie Easement which shall provide Panwest with the right to access the NCA2 Substation Premises for the purpose of constructing, operating and maintaining Project Specific Assets, including, without limitation, overhead transmission lines and related facilities, and ingress and egress access thereto. NCA2 shall comply with all the terms and conditions of the Thermal Lease and the Government Approvals. Panwest shall comply with all the terms and conditions of the Gen-Tie Easement and the Government Approvals (c) NCA2 and Panwest hereby authorize the joint use of those certain Shared Facilities located on or under the Shared Facilities Premises (whether now existing or hereafter constructed). Each Project Company hereby consents to the use of the NCA2 Substation Premises Propety Rights by Manager pursuant to this Agreement, including without limitation, where such NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights affect, or otherwise touch and concern, other real property interests or estates held by such Project Company so long as such use is consistent with the requirements of this Agreement and the rights of the Parties hereunder. 2.2 Shared Facilities. (a) As of the Effective Date, NCA2 has procured, installed and constructed, certain facilities for electrical transmission, interconnection, communications and other structures and facilities within the Shared Facilities Premises, as described on Exhibit C-1, which may be altered or reconstructed in accordance with this Agreement, for the shared use by the Project Companies (collectively, the Existing NCA2 Project Shared Facilities). (b) Panwest will cause the procurement, installation and construction, of certain facilities for electrical transmission, interconnection, communications and other structures and facilities within the Shared Facilities Premises, as described on Exhibit C-1, which may be altered or reconstructed in accordance with this Agreement, for shared use by the Project Companies (collectively, the Panwest Project Shared Facilities, and together with the Existing NCA2 Project Shared Facilities, the Shared Facilities). A depiction of the Shared Facilities is set forth on Exhibit C-2. Pursuant to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the transmission services provided by Manager under this Agreement shall entitle Panwest to firm transmission service over the Shared Facilities. Following the Effective Date, and prior to the commencement of construction by Panwest of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities, Panwest may update the description of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities set forth on Exhibit C-1 attached hereto in order to more accurately reflect the design details of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities which updated description of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities shall be subject to the approval of NCA2 (not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed). 2.3 Access to the Shared Facilities Premises and Shared Facilities. (a) By Project Companies. Subject to the conditions and additional rights described below, each Project Company and any Secured Party of such Project Company shall have access to and the right to enter onto the NCA2 Substation Premises and the Shared Facilities to the extent reasonably necessary for (i) inspection of the Shared Facilities Premises on which the Shared Facilities are situated and the Shared Facilities located thereon, without unduly interfering with the normal operations of the other Project Company or the Manager and otherwise subject to 3 4919-2205-6789.1
the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, (ii) construction or Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities in the event the Manager fails to do so, in accordance with the terms hereof, or (iii) for ingress and egress to and from, and for maintenance or repair of, the Shared Facilities in the event of an Emergency and the failure or unavailability of the Manager or its representatives to respond timely to such Emergency. Except in the event of an Emergency, the accessing Project Company shall give the other Project Company and the Manager at least forty-eight (48) hours prior notice of its intent to enter upon the Shared Facilities Premises (said notice may be by telephone, e-mail, or any other recognized electronic means in addition to any other methods of notice authorized herein). In the event of an Emergency, prior notice is not required, but the Project Company shall give notice of entry onto the Shared Facilities Premises as soon as reasonably practicable thereafter. Any Project Company entering on the NCA2 Substation Premises or accessing the Shared Facilities shall follow all written safety and security procedures adopted by the Project Companies and/or the Manager with respect to the NCA2 Substation Premises and/or the Shared Facilities or otherwise applicable to the Shared Facilities Premises and/or the Shared Facilities under any binding lease, easement, rights-of-way, or crossing agreement benefitting or burdening such Shared Facilities Premises where the terms thereof have been made available to the entering Project Company. Each Project Company acknowledges that each of the agreements set forth on have been made available to it. Notwithstanding the above, if any part of the NCA2 Substation Premises is also subject to a lease agreement, easement, license, rights-of-way or other similar agreement with a Project Company for its respective Project, the Project Company may enter upon any of the NCA2 Substation Premises that is part of such Project Companys rights pursuant to any such lease agreement, easement, license, rights-of-way or other similar agreement without the need to give prior notice or obtain consent as provided in this Section 2.3(a) unless such entry is with respect to the Shared Facilities located thereon and then only to the extent set forth above. (b) By Manager. The Manager shall have access to the NCA2 Substation Premises and the Shared Facilities at any time for purposes of complying with its obligations set forth in this Agreement, including (i) inspection of the Shared Facilities Premises and the Shared Facilities located thereon, without unduly interfering with the normal operations of the Project Companies and otherwise subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, (ii) construction or Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities in accordance with the terms hereof, or (iii) for ingress and egress to and from, and for maintenance or repair of, the Shared Facilities. The Manager shall follow all written safety and security procedures adopted by the Project Companies with respect to the NCA2 Substation Premises or otherwise applicable to the NCA2 Substation Premises under any binding lease, easement, rights-of-way or crossing agreement benefitting or burdening such NCA2 Substation Premises where the terms thereof have been made available to the Manager by notice pursuant to Section 14.1 hereof. (c) By Secured Parties. A Secured Party of a Project Company shall have the right to enter onto the NCA2 Substation Premises for the purposes described in Section 2.3(a)(i) and, in connection with or following the exercise of remedies by the Secured Party under its Security Documents, for the other purposes described in Section 2.3(a), in each case upon five (5) Business Days advance written notice of its entry delivered to the Manager and the other Project Company; provided that such right of entry shall be limited to normal business hours except in the case of an Emergency. Any Secured Party so entering on the NCA2 Substation Premises or 4 4919-2205-6789.1
accessing the Shared Facilities shall (i) follow all written safety and security procedures and other site regulations of the Project Companies and/or the Manager with respect to the NCA2 Substation Premises and/or the Shared Facilities or otherwise applicable to the Shared Facilities Premises and/or the Shared Facilities under any binding lease, easement, rights-of-way or crossing agreement benefitting or burdening such NCA2 Substation Premises where the terms thereof have been made available to the Project Company that is a debtor of such entering Secured Party, and (ii) not unduly interfere with the normal operations of the Project Companies and the Manager thereon. 2.4 No Interference. Each Project Companys use of the Shared Facilities Premises and the Shared Facilities shall comply with the terms of the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights and shall not interfere with the use and enjoyment by the other Project Company of its rights in such Shared Facilities Premises or Shared Facilities, subject to all the terms and provisions of this Agreement. Each of the Project Companies shall cooperate in good faith to accommodate the other Project Companys use of the Shared Facilities Premises and the Shared Facilities for the benefit of the other Project Companys Project. Subject to the first sentence of this Section 2.4, the use of the Shared Facilities Premises and the Shared Facilities by the Project Companies pursuant to and in accordance with the terms of this Agreement will not, separately or in the aggregate, be deemed to constitute an overburdening of the Shared Facilities Premises or the Shared Facilities or any portion of either of them. 2.5 Construction of Panwest Project Shared Facilities. (a) Construction of Panwest Project Shared Facilities. Panwest shall cause the Panwest Project Shared Facilities to be procured, installed, and constructed pursuant to an engineering, procurement, and construction contract to be entered by Panwest (the EPC Contract). (b) Construction under EPC Contract. The Panwest Project Shared Facilities shall be constructed pursuant to design and construction plans and specifications set forth in the EPC Contract; provided, however, NCA2 and Manager shall have the right to approve the EPC Contract solely as it pertains to the construction of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities and any other work to be completed or improvements to be constructed within the NCA2 Substation Premises (the Substation Work) (such approval not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed). Any material amendments or modifications to the EPC Contract that pertain to the Substation Work shall be subject to the approval of NCA2 and Manager (not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed). Panwest shall diligently commence and complete construction of Panwest Project Shared Facilities in accordance with the EPC Contract, applicable Governmental Requirements and Good Utility Practice. The Project Companies and Manager shall cooperate in good faith to coordinate construction of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities, and Panwest shall use commercially reasonable efforts to minimize any adverse impacts of such construction activities on the NCA2 Project including limitation of down-time periods and to ensure continued access in and to the NCA2 Substation Premises as necessary. Panwest shall use commercially reasonable efforts to have Panwest and the Manager identified as beneficiaries of the warranties and indemnities obtained with respect to the Panwest Project Shared Facilities. Ownership of any improvements, materials, equipment, parts, or supplies stored on, installed, or placed on the NCA2 Substation Premises by or for Panwest in connection with the Panwest Project 5 4919-2205-6789.1
Shared Facilities (collectively, the Panwest Project Shared Facilities Improvements) shall be vested in Panwest. NCA2 shall have no ownership or other interest in any of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities Improvements. Panwest shall have title to all Panwest Project Shared Facilities Improvements, whether or not the same shall be affixed to, placed on, or stored within the Shared Facilities Premises. The Panwest Project Shared Facilities Improvements are personal property within the meaning of Article 9 of the Uniform Commercial Code as in effect in the State of Nevada (or any replacement or successor statue or code), regardless of the manner of attachment to the Shared Facilities Premises. Pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Thermal Lease, Panwest shall provide NCA2 advance notice of the commencement of any construction activity on the NCA2 Substation Premises which notification NCA2 shall forward to Pacific Coast within thirty (30) days before the activity is commenced. (c) Payment of Panwest Project Shared Facilities Construction Costs. Panwest shall be responsible for payment of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities Construction Costs. Panwest shall pay directly to the applicable Contractor under the EPC Contract the Panwest Project Shared Facilities Construction Costs as and when due pursuant to the EPC Contract. (d) Monitoring and Step-In Rights. (i) Panwest and NCA2 shall have the right, at their sole cost and expense, to monitor the construction of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities, and Manager shall afford reasonable access to the Project Companies for such purpose. When exercising such monitoring right, the Project Companies shall not interfere with the construction activities of any Contractor and shall comply with all of Contractors workplace safety and security requirements. (ii) If any default by Manager has occurred and is continuing under the O&M Agreement, and Manager has not cured such default within ten (10) days after its occurrence, in the case of a default that can be cured by the payment of money, or thirty (30) days after its occurrence, in the case of a default that cannot be cured solely by the payment of money, either Panwest or NCA2, to the extent such Party is not then acting as the Manager, may, upon two (2) days notice to Manager and the other Project Company, cure such default on behalf of Manager and take such other actions as may be reasonably necessary to preserve the Parties rights under the O&M Agreement. (e) Requested Modifications to Shared Facilities. In the event (i) a Project Company desires that Manager design, install or construct as part of the Shared Facilities any improvements or installations, in each case, that primarily serve such Project Companys Project, (ii) such improvements, installations or changes would not otherwise be included by the Manager in the Shared Facilities, (iii) the Manager has received a certificate or report from an Independent Engineer confirming, and is otherwise satisfied in its reasonable discretion, that such additional improvements or installations will not adversely affect any other Project, and (iv) such Project Company has fully funded the cost of such improvements or installations, as estimated by Manager, Manager will design, install and construct such additional improvements or installations that otherwise would not be part of the Shared Facilities, at the sole cost and expense of such requesting Project Company. Manager shall be responsible for determining the final actual cost of such improvements or installations and to the extent the costs incurred by Manager exceed those 6 4919-2205-6789.1
funded by the applicable Project Company, such Project Company shall promptly fund the difference in such amount to Manager. If Manager determines that the applicable Project Company funded an amount in excess of the actual cost of such improvements or installations, Manager shall promptly refund such excess amount to the Project Company. Prior to the commencement of the design, installation and construction of such additional improvements or installations the Manager and such Project Company shall agree on a fee to be paid to Manager in connection with Managers responsibilities pursuant to this Section 2.5(e), and in the event the Manager and the Project Company cannot agree to such fee, such Project Company shall instead be solely responsible for the design, installation and construction of such additional improvements or installations. 2.6 Additional Facilities. (a) Approval of Additional Facilities. To the extent that any additional facilities, improvements, modifications, or upgrades of facilities that relate to the Shared Facilities or operation thereof (Additional Facilities) (i) are required in order to construct, use, operate, maintain or repair the Shared Facilities, (ii) are required by any Project Company for the construction, use, operation, maintenance or repair of its Project, or (iii) are needed or would materially benefit, in the reasonable belief of the Manager, the interconnection or operation of the Projects collectively, a Project Company or the Manager, as applicable, may give written notice to the other Parties of such requirement, which shall (A) include a reasonable explanation why such Additional Facilities are needed and demonstrating that such Additional Facilities will not, taken as a whole, have an adverse effect on the Shared Facilities, any Project, or any telemetry, metering, communication, or other equipment or facilities installed by NVE within the NCA2 Substation Premises (collectively, the NVE Facilities), and (B) include a report of the Independent Engineer confirming that (y) the design, construction plans, and specifications of the Additional Facilities are compatible with the Projects and the NVE Facilities, and (z) the Additional Facilities are designed in accordance with Good Utility Practice. The Party proposing such Additional Facilities shall bear and directly pay the cost of the Independent Engineers report. (1) Each Project Company shall, within thirty (30) days after receiving such notice, notify the Manager and the other Project Company in writing of its election to participate or not to participate in such Additional Facilities. Failure to notify the Manager or other Project Company of its election to participate shall be deemed an election not to participate. (2) If any Additional Facilities are approved by all of the Project Companies, such Additional Facilities shall be acquired in the name of all of the Project Companies as tenants in common in proportion to their respective Proportionate Shares and shall become Shared Facilities hereunder; provided, however, the Project Companies may otherwise agree that any such Additional Facilities shall instead remain separately owned by the Project Company primarily benefitting from such Additional Facilities. (3) Following the construction of any Additional Facilities, the Parties will amend Exhibits C-1 and C-2 as necessary to describe and reflect such new Shared Facilities. 7 4919-2205-6789.1
(b) Disapproved Additional Facilities. If any proposed Additional Facilities are not approved pursuant to the provisions of Section 2.6(a) above, but the requirements of Section 2.6(c) below are satisfied and any additional facilities, improvements, modifications or upgrades are constructed and installed in accordance with Governmental Requirements and Good Utility Practice, then nothing herein shall prevent a Project Company from installing such additional facilities, improvements, modifications or upgrades (Disapproved Additional Facilities) in its own name. Any such Disapproved Additional Facilities shall not be deemed Shared Facilities hereunder. (c) Requirements of Additional Facilities. No Additional Facilities (including any Disapproved Additional Facilities) may be acquired, constructed or installed by any Project Company, if such acquisition, construction or installation could reasonably be expected to (i) result in an Emergency, (ii) violate the terms of this Agreement, the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights, the Interconnection Agreements, any Revenue Agreement, or any Security Documents, or (iii) have any more than an insignificant adverse effect on the operation, performance, reliability or maintenance costs of any Project (except as may be agreed by the Party owning such Project), or the operation, performance, reliability or Operation and Maintenance costs of the Shared Facilities; provided, however, that if requested by the Project Company proposing to construct or install the Additional Facilities, a Project Company will use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain any necessary consents under the Security Documents related to its Project to allow the construction and/or installation of such Additional Facilities. (d) Construction of Additional Facilities. Manager shall procure, install and construct any Additional Facilities approved in accordance with Section 2.6(a), on behalf of, and as agent of, the Project Company or Project Companies, as applicable. The Additional Facilities shall be constructed pursuant to design and construction plans and specifications approved by the Project Companies in accordance with Section 2.6(a). Manager shall diligently commence and complete construction of the Additional Facilities in accordance with the applicable construction contract, applicable Governmental Requirements and Good Utility Practice. The Project Companies and Manager shall cooperate in good faith to coordinate construction of the Additional Facilities in order to minimize any adverse impacts of such construction activities on the Projects including limitation of down-time periods and to ensure continued access in and to the NCA2 Substation Premises as necessary. (e) Payment of Additional Facilities Construction Costs. Each Project Company shall be responsible for its Proportionate Share of the Additional Facilities Construction Costs. Each Project Company shall reimburse Manager for its Proportionate Share of the Additional Facilities Construction Costs incurred by Manager prior to commencement of construction under any applicable construction contract, and shall thereafter either pay directly to the applicable contractor its Proportionate Share of Additional Facilities Construction Costs as and when due pursuant to the applicable construction contract, or reimburse Manager for its Proportionate Share thereof within thirty (30) days of being invoiced therefor, as directed by Manager. Amounts (including amounts determined to be due after resolution of a Dispute) that are not paid as and when due shall accrue interest at the Default Interest Rate until paid. In the event of any dispute regarding the allocation and reimbursement of the Additional Facilities Construction Costs between the Parties which cannot be resolved within sixty (60) days after 8 4919-2205-6789.1
reasonably diligent good faith efforts, any Party may seek arbitration of the Dispute pursuant to the provisions of Article 13 below. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event shall any dispute regarding allocation of costs require the Manager to delay or suspend construction of any Additional Facilities. 2.7 Liens. No Party shall, directly or indirectly, create, incur or permit to exist any lien on the Shared Facilities, either as a whole or in a Partys undivided interest therein, except for (a) liens for financing purposes as provided in Section 8.3, and (b) Permitted Encumbrances. If any lien not permitted under the previous sentence attaches to any of the Shared Facilities, or if a Party receives notice of any such lien, the Party whose actual or alleged act or omission resulted in such lien shall cause such lien to be released and removed of record within thirty (30) days of such attachment or notice. Failure of a Party to remove such lien as required under this Section 2.7 shall entitle each other Party to cause such lien to be removed and the costs thereof shall be promptly reimbursed by the Party responsible hereunder for removal of such lien. Notwithstanding the forgoing, nothing herein shall require a Project Company to remove a lien that relates to its separate property interest in property that is also located on or within the NCA2 Substation Premises, if such lien relates to such Project Companys rights in and to that portion of the NCA2 Substation Premises by virtue of a separate lease, easement or license agreement. ARTICLE 3 ALLOCATION AND PAYMENT OF O&M EXPENSES 3.1 Expenses of Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities. The Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities shall be performed in accordance with the requirements set forth in Article 5 below. The expenses of such Operation and Maintenance shall be allocated among the Project Companies and paid as provided in this Article 3. (a) Shared O&M Expenses. Following energization of the Panwest Project, each Project Company shall be responsible for and shall pay its Proportionate Share of the expenses and liabilities relating to the Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities, including all allocable payments under the O&M Agreement, all FERC compliance costs, NERC compliance costs, costs of compliance with other Governmental Requirements, costs of labor and materials and accounting, general and administrative costs (collectively, Shared O&M Expenses); provided that prior to energization of the Panwest Project, NCA2 shall be solely responsible for Shared O&M Expenses. (b) Management Fee. During the term of this Agreement and commencing upon energization of the Panwest Project, Manager shall receive a Management Fee as compensation for the services rendered by Manager under this Agreement equal to the amount set forth on Schedule 1 attached hereto payable by the Project Companies each calendar year (the Management Fee). The Management Fee shall be considered Shared O&M Expenses as provided in Section 3.1(a) and shall be automatically added to the then current Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget if not already included. (c) Step-In Rights; Indemnity. If any Project Company fails to pay its share of Shared O&M Expenses as and when due, including any amounts that may be due to the Manager 9 4919-2205-6789.1
hereunder, then, upon at least five (5) days written notice to the defaulting Project Company, the other Project Company may, but shall not be obligated to, advance any amounts which such defaulting Project Company failed to pay, and such defaulting Project Company shall promptly reimburse the Project Company making such advances upon demand for all such amounts advanced on behalf of the defaulting Project Company, together with interest thereon from the date advanced to the date repaid at the Default Interest Rate. 3.2 Invoicing, Late Payments. (a) The Manager shall be responsible for invoicing each Project Company for its applicable Proportionate Share of the Shared O&M Expenses relating to the Shared Facilities. Each such invoice shall be payable by the invoiced Project Company within fifteen (15) days after receipt of an invoice, with backup documentation, from the Manager setting forth the amount that is due. If a Project Company disputes the invoiced amount, it shall nonetheless pay the disputed amount, and shall refer the issue for resolution in accordance with the provisions of Article 13. Any disputed amount that is finally determined by dispute resolution pursuant to Article 13 or by mutual agreement to have been improperly invoiced shall be promptly refunded to the Project Company. All sums not paid when due shall thereafter bear interest at the Default Interest Rate. Each Project Company shall have the right to audit, and receive supporting documentation for, any expenses or other amounts required to be paid by such Project Company hereunder. (b) In addition to the reports under Section 5.7, within thirty (30) days after the end of each calendar year, the Manager shall provide the Project Companies an annual statement of all actual Shared O&M Expenses during the previous calendar year, all payments made by each Project Company on account of Shared O&M Expenses, and a reconciliation of the amounts paid by each such Project Company against such Project Companys Proportionate Share of the actual Shared O&M Expenses during such calendar year. If any Project Companys share of such Shared O&M Expenses exceeds the amounts paid by such Project Company, such Project Company shall pay the amount of such difference to the Manager as part of the next monthly invoice. If any Project Companys share of such Shared O&M Expenses is less than the amounts paid by such Project Company, the Manager shall credit the amount of such overpayment by such Project Company against future invoiced amounts from the Manager until such credit is exhausted. 3.3 Property Taxes and Assessments. The Manager shall allocate all property taxes on the attributable Shared Facilities, whether payable as owner or lessee, to the Project Companies in proportion to their respective Proportionate Shares. If desired by the Manager, or by all of the affected Project Companies, the Manager shall, at the sole cost of the affected Project Companies, contest the validity or amount of any assessments or taxes attributable to the Shared Facilities for which the Parties are responsible hereunder by appropriate legal proceedings. Such costs shall be deemed a Shared O&M Expense and shall be reimbursable by the applicable Project Companies regardless of whether included in the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget. 3.4 Costs of Repair Work. The Manager shall charge for the costs of Repairs of Shared Facilities and other work or services provided by the Manager, including costs paid to third parties, at the actual cost to the Manager therefor. 10 4919-2205-6789.1
3.5 Shared Facilities O&M Budget. (a) Upon Substantial Completion of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities and no later than sixty (60) days prior to the beginning of each calendar year thereafter during the term hereof, the Manager shall prepare and submit to the Parties a proposed budget for Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities for the following calendar year, or the portions of the calendar year remaining after Substantial Completion of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities (each, a Shared Facilities O&M Budget), which budget shall include the estimated cost of all anticipated Shared O&M Expenses during the following year; provided that, such Shared Facilities O&M Budget shall not include the cost of construction of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities or any Additional Facilities, which costs shall be governed by the applicable provisions of Article 2. The Shared Facilities O&M Budget shall set forth the respective amounts allocated to the Project Companies in accordance with Exhibit D hereto. When approved pursuant to subparagraph (b) below, the Shared Facilities O&M Budget shall be the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget for such year. (b) The Shared Facilities O&M Budget shall be subject to the approval of all of the Project Companies (such approval not to be unreasonably withheld); provided, however, that the portion of the Shared Facilities O&M Budget reflecting the cost and expenses to be paid pursuant to the O&M Agreement and any other third party operations and maintenance agreement entered into by Manager consistent with this Agreement are deemed approved Shared O&M Expenses hereunder. The Project Companies shall give their approval or disapproval of the Shared Facilities O&M Budget no later than thirty (30) days after receipt thereof from the Manager; provided that, pending approval, Manager may operate and maintain the Shared Facilities based on the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget for the previous calendar year, as adjusted by the Inflation Adjustment Factor and further increased an additional two and one-half percent (2.5%) in each budget category. (c) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the Manager shall be permitted to, in its reasonable discretion, incur, or cause the incurrence of, on behalf of the Project Companies, (i) costs and expenses for the Operation and Maintenance of Shared Facilities in a given year in amounts that exceed the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget by up to (but not more than) twenty-five percent (25%), and (ii) any expenses needed to respond to an Emergency to ensure safe operation of the Shared Facilities or to return the Shared Facilities from any outage, including, if applicable, pursuant to Section 5.2(g), and such excess expenses shall be deemed approved Shared O&M Expenses hereunder. 3.6 Other Expenses Caused By Parties. Notwithstanding the provisions of this Agreement, any costs, claims, loss or other liability to third parties (including but not limited to penalties and disgorgement ordered by FERC or NERC and any payments to settle a matter of non-compliance) arising from the actions or inactions of a Party in violation or breach of the covenants herein or the provisions of any NCA2 Substation Premises Property Right, the Interconnection Agreements, or a Revenue Agreement shall be the responsibility of such Party (to the extent not covered by the policies of insurance required under Article 7 below, provided that such Party shall pay all deductibles due under such policies with respect thereto) and such Party shall timely pay to any third parties all amounts due and owing for any such costs and expenses. 11 4919-2205-6789.1
3.7 Rights of Other Party for Non-Payment. If a Party (a Non-Paying Party) fails to timely make any required payment of amounts due under Article 2 or this Article 3, one or more of the other Parties may make such payment on behalf of such Non-Paying Party and the amount so paid shall be immediately due and payable from the Non-Paying Party to such other Party or Parties, together with interest at the Default Interest Rate from the date paid until repaid to such other Party or Parties. ARTICLE 4 OTHER RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS OF THE PARTIES 4.1 Maximum Capacity of Projects. The maximum capacity (Maximum Capacity) shall mean (subject to this Section 4.1), with respect to any Project, the maximum net capacity, in MW, of each Project, set forth in Exhibit E, which Maximum Capacity may be changed only in accordance with this Agreement and the Interconnection Agreements, provided that the combined Maximum Capacity of any Project shall not exceed the lesser of the maximum net generation capacity of the Project as measured at the Point of Interconnection or the maximum allowable capacity for such Project under its Interconnection Agreement. Each Project Company shall be authorized to construct its Project with a nameplate capacity of up to, but not in excess of, the Maximum Capacity as measured at the Point of Interconnection for such Project as set forth on Exhibit E. 4.2 Maintenance and Repair of Projects. Without limiting each Project Companys obligations under its respective Thermal Lease or Solar Lease, or its respective Interconnection Agreement, each Project Company shall, at its sole cost and expense, (a) maintain in good working order and repair at all times each part of its Project which connects with or may affect the Shared Facilities or the Shared Facilities Premises, (b) comply with all applicable requirements of NERC and any Governmental Requirements relating to the Shared Facilities and the Shared Facilities Premises, (c) comply with all applicable easements, licenses, encroachment permits, rights-of-way, and crossing agreements pertinent to or affecting the Shared Facilities or the Shared Facilities Premises, and (d) comply with all curtailment orders received by the Project Company from the Manager. 4.3 Termination or Modification of Any NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights. No Project Company shall modify or amend any of the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights in a manner that materially, adversely affects the other Project Company without the prior written consent of that Project Company; provided, however, that if a Project Company intends to abandon or cease operation of its Project, it may do so only in accordance with Article 9 below. 4.4 Standard of Performance. Each Party shall perform its obligations under this Agreement (a) in accordance with all requirements of this Agreement, all Governmental Requirements, Good Utility Practice, the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights, the Interconnection Agreements, and any applicable requirements of FERC and NERC, and the Participating Transmission Owner, and (b) in a manner that is (i) non-discriminatory, and (ii) attempts to maximize the delivery of energy and energy-related products from the Projects to the Point of Interconnection at a reasonable cost. 12 4919-2205-6789.1
4.5 Party Representatives. On or promptly after the Effective Date, each Party shall by written notice to the other Parties designate an individual representative of such Party and an alternate (the Party Representative) whose written instructions, requests, and decisions will be binding upon such Party in all matters concerning this Agreement, except that the Partys Representative shall not have the authority to amend this Agreement. Each Party shall have the right to change such Partys Representative at any time and from time to time by written notice to the other Parties. 4.6 No Warranties. No Party makes any warranty, express or implied with respect to the Shared Facilities, the Shared Facilities Premises, the Additional Facilities, or Qualified Replacement Components. THE FOREGOING EXCLUSION OF ALL WARRANTIES BY EACH PARTY INCLUDES IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF SUITABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. 4.7 Withdrawal of Party. Subject to the provisions of this Section 4.7, if a Project Company determines that it will cease operation of or otherwise abandon its Project or not require any Shared Facilities hereunder, such Project Company shall have the right to withdraw from this Agreement, subject to the requirements of Article 9, provided written notice thereof is given to the other Parties. Following such permitted withdrawal, the withdrawing Project Company shall have no further right to use the Shared Facilities. No such withdrawal shall release the withdrawing Project Company from any indemnification or reimbursement obligations that arise prior to the effective date of its withdrawal, including its obligation to pay its Proportionate Share of the Additional Facilities Construction Costs and the Shared O&M Expenses, the Panwest Project Shared Facilities Construction Costs, and all applicable costs described in Sections 9.2, 9.3 and 9.4. Panwest may not withdraw from this Agreement until after Substantial Completion of construction of the Panwest Project Shared Facilities. 4.8 No Waste or Nuisance. To the extent that a Party has the authority under this Agreement (or any applicable third party agreement) to prevent such actions or inactions, no Party will use or permit the use of the Shared Facilities or Shared Facilities Services in any manner that would create waste or nuisance, or that would increase the rate, or jeopardize the issuance or maintenance, of any insurance policy relating to the Shared Facilities or any Project, nor otherwise conduct or cause to be conducted operations on its Properties which would have similar effects on, or otherwise damage or interfere with, the Shared Facilities or any other Project. The Parties will at all times while conducting their respective operations make commercially reasonable efforts to minimize the impact of such operations and activities upon the other Parties. 4.9 No Public Access. The Parties agree that, except as required to comply with the terms of a NCA2 Substation Premises Property Right or unless so ordered by a Governmental Authority, there will be no general public access to the NCA2 Substation Premises or the Shared Facilities. The Parties shall undertake to cooperate in enforcing such requirement for limiting access to the NCA2 Substation Premises and the Shared Facilities, including establishing and enforcing procedures for safety and security. 4.10 Competing Ventures. Any Party may engage in or possess an interest in other business ventures of any nature and description, independently or with others, including but not limited to the ownership, financing, leasing, management, syndication, investment, brokerage and 13 4919-2205-6789.1
development of real property (including real property of the same type and nature as the Projects), and no Party shall have any right by virtue of this Agreement in and to such independent ventures or to the income or profits derived therefrom. 4.11 FERC Approvals. If required by law, this Agreement will be filed for acceptance with FERC. Promptly after the Effective Date and after any amendment to the Agreement that is required to be filed at FERC, the Parties will cooperate in the preparation of a filing by the Manager, on behalf of the Project Companies, acceptable to all Parties to seek acceptance by FERC of the Agreement or such amendment and the Manager, on behalf of the Project Companies, will file the Agreement or such amendment for acceptance by FERC. Each of the Parties agrees that it will cooperate in the preparation of such filings and as necessary to address any issues raised by FERC in connection with the filing for acceptance of the Agreement or such amendment. Subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein, the Parties agree to execute and deliver all documents reasonably necessary for this Agreement to comply with FERC requirements. 4.12 Conflict Among Agreements. In the event of any conflict between the Managers obligations under this Agreement or the Interconnection Agreements, the terms of the applicable Interconnection Agreement shall prevail. The Manager shall notify the Project Companies in writing if it becomes aware of any such conflict and the Parties shall discuss whether amendments to this Agreement are necessary to address such matters. 4.13 SCADA Access. Each Project Company shall be permitted access to SCADA data regarding the NCA2 Substation and its own Project. The Manager shall be permitted full access to SCADA data, including the NCA2 Substation and all Projects. The Project Companies are not permitted access to SCADA data regarding the Projects of other Project Companies. ARTICLE 5 OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE SHARED FACILITIES PREMISES AND THE SHARED FACILITIES 5.1 In General. (a) The Manager shall perform, or cause the performance of, the Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities in accordance with this Agreement. The costs and expenses incurred to maintain the Shared Facilities, whether by Manager or a third party, shall be incurred and shared in accordance with Article 3. Each of the Project Companies shall cooperate with the Manager in the performance of the Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities. (b) The Manager shall enter into an operations and maintenance agreement (O&M Agreement) with a third party operation and maintenance provider to perform such services (provided that (i) the Manager shall have obtained the prior written consent of all of the Project Companies with respect to the identity of the operation and maintenance provider and the form and substance of the O&M Agreement, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed and (ii) absent good cause and subject to compliance with NERC requirements and Governmental Requirements, only one operation and maintenance provider shall 14 4919-2205-6789.1
be engaged to perform such services), and payments by the Manager under the O&M Agreement will be Shared O&M Expenses as provided in Section 3.1(a). 5.2 Specific Authority. Without limiting the authority of the Manager pursuant to Section 5.1, but subject to the limitations of authority of the Manager in Section 5.3 below, the Manager (in its capacity as Manager) shall have the power, without further consent or approval of the Parties: (a) To perform, or cause the performance of, the Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities, including any Repairs subject to the requirements of Section 5.4 below. (b) Subject to Sections 5.1(b) and 5.4, to negotiate, enter into, execute, acknowledge or amend agreements relating to the Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities, provided that (i) no such actions would reasonably be expected to adversely affect the rights or privileges of the Parties except with respect to incurring additional expenses for the accounts of the Parties that are within the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget (and any amounts in excess thereof permitted under this Agreement) and (ii) the Manager shall provide each Party with copies of any such agreement promptly upon execution thereof; (c) To, or to cause a third party acting on its behalf to, (i) exercise all of Managers and the Project Companies rights under the warranties with respect to the Shared Facilities, Additional Facilities, or Repairs, as applicable; (ii) monitor and report to the Project Companies concerning the remaining terms of any such warranties; (iii) perform such inspections as are reasonable to ensure that any final warranty work is not required prior to the expiration of any such warranty, and (iv) prepare and prosecute warranty claims, if reasonably necessary to enforce any such warranties; (d) To employ from time to time, at the expense of the Project Companies but subject to the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget, persons, firms or corporations to perform Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities, including entering into an O&M Agreement; (e) To pay and collect amounts due in connection with the Shared Facilities, and to maintain one or more bank accounts wherein funds received by the Manager in connection with its duties hereunder shall be maintained; (f) To expend monies necessary for Operation and Maintenance in accordance with the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget (including any amounts in excess thereof permitted under this Agreement); (g) To commit to the expenditure of or spend such amounts for and on behalf of the Project Companies as are reasonably necessary to expedite Repairs to the Shared Facilities due to an Emergency up to and including Twenty Thousand Dollars ($20,000) in the aggregate (including the costs of installation and expediting fees), provided that the Manager gives notice by facsimile or electronic mail to the Project Companies regarding the nature and amount of the expenditure as soon as reasonably practicable after the estimated amount of the expenditure is known by the Manager, but in any event no later than the time the Manager commits to the expenditure; 15 4919-2205-6789.1
(h) To negotiate with, and represent the Parties interests before any Governmental Authority regarding property valuation related to the Shared Facilities; and (i) to execute, acknowledge and deliver any and all instruments and take such other steps as are reasonably necessary to effectuate the foregoing and as are consistent with the terms of this Agreement, including Section 5.3 and any other limitations set forth herein. 5.3 Limitation on Authority. The Manager shall not (in its capacity as Manager), without the approval of all of the Project Companies: (a) Amend, modify or waive the terms of this Agreement or the Interconnection Agreements; (b) Create or cause to be created any lien or encumbrance on the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights or the Shared Facilities, other than a Permitted Encumbrance; (c) Perform or omit to perform any act which would cause any person reasonably to believe that the Manager is authorized to bind the Project Companies, except as expressly permitted under this Agreement; (d) Sell, assign, mortgage, encumber, convey or otherwise transfer all or any portion of (i) the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights or NCA2 Substation Premises, or any interest or estate therein, or (ii) any Shared Facilities or any of the components thereof, other than the trade-in, sale or transfer of assets related thereto that are worn out, obsolete or no longer necessary or useful for the operation thereof; (e) Borrow funds on behalf of the Project Companies; (f) Agree to any restrictions or limitations on the NCA2 Substation Premises, the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights, or the Shared Facilities that do not exist as of the Effective Date; (g) Take any action to voluntarily and permanently remove any Shared Facilities from service, except to the extent they are being replaced with new or repaired facilities; (h) Take any action which could reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on the ability of any Project Company to use the Shared Facilities or the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights; except as required or permitted under this Agreement, the Interconnection Agreements or any Revenue Agreement; (i) Incur expenses in respect of the Shared Facilities and/or the NCA2 Substation Premises except in accordance with this Agreement and/or the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget in any calendar year except as provided in this Agreement; (j) Except as provided in the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget or as provided in Sections 3.5(c) and 5.2(g), enter into any commitments, contracts or other agreements 16 4919-2205-6789.1
in respect of the Shared Facilities requiring expenditures in excess of Twenty Thousand Dollars ($20,000) or with a duration of more than one (1) year except for (i) permitted expenditures in the case of an Emergency or as contemplated by the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget, or (ii) expenditures under the O&M Agreement or any approved amendment thereto; (k) Except as permitted under Sections 7.9 and 7.10, procure insurance coverage with respect to the Shared Facilities that is less than the coverage required under Article 7; (l) Enter into or materially modify any agreement with any Affiliate of the Manager in respect of the Shared Facilities and/or the NCA2 Substation Premises, other than agreements approved as part of the financing of the Projects, except on terms and conditions, including price, that are at least as favorable to the Project Companies as would be obtained from an unaffiliated third party; or (m) Waive, settle, or otherwise resolve claims, demands, alleged breaches of contract or other liabilities in respect of the Shared Facilities in excess of Ten Thousand Dollars ($10,000). 5.4 Repairs. (a) The Manager shall have the right to replace or repair, or to cause to be replaced or repaired, any component or group of components of the Shared Facilities (i) with an aggregate cost of Ten Thousand Dollars ($10,000) or less, or (ii) that must be repaired to ensure the continued safe operation of the Shared Facilities or to return the Shared Facilities to service, with a Qualified Replacement Component, consistent with Good Utility Practice (such repair or replacement work, Repairs). The Manager shall provide notice (the Repairs Notice) in writing to the Project Companies of (i) any required Repairs, (ii) the proposed scope of the Repairs (the Proposed Repairs), including the material components to be used in such Proposed Repairs, which shall be Qualified Replacement Components, (iii) the estimated cost of the Repairs, and (iv) the anticipated commencement date and anticipated completion date of the work on such Repairs. No other notice of such Repairs shall be required except as such costs may be included in periodic financial and operating reports that may be required under this Agreement. Repairs with an aggregate cost greater than Ten Thousand Dollars ($10,000) that are not required to ensure the continued safe operation of the Shared Facilities or to return the Shared Facilities to service, must be approved by all of the Project Companies. (b) If the Manager performs any Repairs, it shall (i) limit, to the extent commercially reasonable and subject to Good Utility Practice, any interference with the use by the Project Companies of the Shared Facilities and Shared Facilities Premises during construction activities, (ii) except in the event of an Emergency, to the extent commercially reasonable and subject to Good Utility Practice, (A) schedule during an off-peak and/or low charge/discharge down-time period any required disconnection of the Shared Facilities to conduct construction activities in order to minimize any adverse impact on the Project Companies Projects, and (B) provide at least thirty (30) days prior written notice of commencement of such construction activities together with a reasonably detailed description thereof, and (iii) comply with the requirements of Participating Transmission Owner with respect thereto. 17 4919-2205-6789.1
(c) The Manager or any other Project Company performing any Repairs (with respect to such Repairs) shall use commercially reasonable efforts to have all Project Companies and the Manager identified as beneficiaries of the warranties and indemnities obtained with respect to any Repairs. 5.5 Curtailment of Delivery. (a) The Project Companies shall have the right to curtail the charging and discharging of their respective Projects from time to time as they see fit unless such curtailment would cause an Emergency. The Manager may, in accordance with this Section 5.5, direct the Project Companies to interrupt or reduce charging and discharging of electrical power through the Shared Facilities (i) when necessary for the Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities or to connect Additional Facilities or to connect or energize a new Project (including the Panwest Project); (ii) if the Manager determines, in its reasonable discretion, that interruption or reduction is necessary due to an Emergency; or (iii) at the direction of the Participating Transmission Owner pursuant to rights under the Interconnection Agreements. The Manager will use commercially reasonable efforts to give the Project Companies as much advance notice as is reasonably possible of such interruptions, reductions, or curtailments, and the Manager shall reasonably consider any objections or requests from any Project Company consistent with this Section 5.5. The Manager under the Interconnection Agreements shall promptly give the Manager written notice of any directions, instructions or orders from the Participating Transmission Owner to interrupt or reduce deliveries of electrical power and, to the extent that action is required under the Interconnection Agreements to implement any such interruptions, reductions or curtailments, the Manager under the Interconnection Agreements shall take such actions as the Manager may request in connection with such interruptions, reductions or curtailments under this Agreement. (b) With respect to any interruption or reduction of the charging or discharging of electrical power pursuant to clauses (i) or (ii) of Section 5.5(a), but subject to Section 5.5(c)(1), the Manager shall curtail delivery of energy used to charge that is discharged from any Project that is still undergoing Trial Operations (Test Power) and has not reached commercial operation as provided in the applicable Interconnection Agreement before curtailing the charging or discharging of any Project that has reached commercial operation under the applicable Interconnection Agreement and shall limit the length of any such interruption or curtailment to the minimum extent and minimum time strictly necessary to correct the problem; provided that any additional interruption or reduction of the charging or discharging of any Project beyond curtailment of Test Power shall follow the curtailment priority in Section 5.5(c) below. Any interruption or curtailment made pursuant to clause (i) of Section 5.5(a) shall be made to the extent commercially reasonable during off-peak and/or low charge/discharge down-time periods. (c) In the event of any curtailment of interconnection services at the direction of the Participating Transmission Owner, subject to Section 5.5(d), such curtailment shall be allocated to the Projects in the following manner, to the extent necessary, until such curtailment is achieved: (1) first, to the extent that the need for any curtailment, interruption or reduction can be attributed to a particular Project Companys Project or portions of its Project or the failure of such Project to comply with the order to curtail or a default by 18 4919-2205-6789.1
such Project Company under this Agreement, its Interconnection Agreement or an applicable Revenue Agreement, or to the extent such Project Companys Project is the cause of an Emergency Condition or is directed by the Participating Transmission Owner to curtail, then (A) all such curtailment shall be allocated to such Project Company and such Project Company will be responsible for all costs, liabilities and damages, including lost revenues, resulting from such curtailment (subject to the limitations in this Agreement), and (B) the Manager shall, to the extent possible, limit such interruption or reduction to such Project or such portions of the Project, as the case may be. (2) second, each Project Company (if any) that is charging or discharging, as applicable, energy in excess of such Project Companys Maximum Capacity shall reduce such charging or discharging down to such Project Companys Maximum Capacity; (3) third, to the extent it has not already been curtailed pursuant to Section 5.5(b), each Project Company that is charging or discharging Test Power shall reduce all such charging or discharging to the extent required to achieve such curtailment (including down to zero, if necessary); and (4) fourth, subject to Section 5.5(d)(1), to the extent its Project has not already been fully curtailed, each Project Company shall reduce its energy charging or discharging, as applicable, so that they do not exceed an amount (the Curtailed Output Cap) equal to (X) such Project Companys Maximum Capacity, minus (Y) the product of (i) the aggregate number of MWs then required for the Projects as a whole to curtail (after application of preceding clauses (c)(1), (2), and (3) times (ii) such Project Companys Proportionate Share; provided that if during any relevant period of curtailment any Project Company is charging or discharging energy, as applicable, at a level less than its Curtailed Output Cap (any such amount, a Shortfall) either because such Project Companys Project is undergoing maintenance, has a forced outage, or other circumstance, then for so long as such Shortfall exists, each other Project Company may charge or discharge energy, as applicable, above such Project Companys Curtailed Output Cap by allocating among such other Project Companies the Shortfall on a pro rata basis in accordance with such other Project Companies Proportionate Share. (d) Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Section 5.5, the Manager shall be authorized to curtail on a non-pro rata, but equitable and reasonable basis (as determined by the Manager in good faith) if (A) in spite of the Managers good faith efforts to direct the Project Companies to comply with this Section 5.5, curtailment of deliveries from the Projects as directed by the Participating Transmission Owner is not otherwise achievable, or (B) such non-pro rata allocation is otherwise necessary to comply with the Interconnection Agreements or the Participating Transmission Owners direction, and, in each of the foregoing clauses (A) and (B), that such non-pro rata allocation will not result in a default under the Interconnection Agreements. (e) Each Project Company shall promptly implement such curtailment, interruption in, or reduction of, delivery as the Manager shall direct pursuant to this Section 5.5. In the event notice is impracticable or if a Project Company fails to promptly comply therewith, the Manager may take direct action to implement such curtailment, interruption, or reduction. A 19 4919-2205-6789.1
Project Company that fails to implement any such curtailment, interruption, or reduction, shall be responsible for all cost and expenses related thereto, including deviation or imbalance charges and penalties assessed by the Participating Transmission Owner. (f) In order to facilitate the scheduling of outages and disconnections of the Shared Facilities, each Project Company shall provide written notice to the Manager of any and all scheduled outages no later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date. Thereafter on or before December 31 of each year, each Project Company shall provide to the Manager its forecasted scheduled outages of its Project for the next calendar year. The Manager shall make all commercially reasonable efforts to schedule Repairs in a manner that is consistent with the Project Companys scheduled outage requirements. (g) Prior to curtailment or disconnection under Section 5.5(a)(i) in order to connect Additional Facilities, the Manager shall give the Project Companies no less than sixty (60) days prior written notice of such curtailment or disconnection, and the Project Company or Project Companies benefitting from such Additional Facilities shall reimburse the other Project Companies for their reasonably calculated and substantiated lost revenues resulting directly from such curtailment or disconnection. In addition, if any curtailment or disconnection under Section 5.5(a)(i) is required in order to connect or energize a new Project (including the Panwest Project), the Manager and/or Panwest, as applicable, shall give the other Parties no less than sixty (60) days prior written notice of such curtailment or disconnection, and the Project Company owning such Project that is being connected or energized shall reimburse the other Project Company for its reasonably calculated and substantiated lost revenues and other out-of-pocket costs resulting directly from such curtailment or disconnection. In connection with the connection and energization of the Panwest Project, Manager and/or Panwest, shall, to the extent commercially reasonable and subject to Good Utility Practice, schedule and conduct construction activities relating thereto during off-peak and/or low charge/discharge down-time periods including any required disconnection of the Shared Facilities in order to minimize any adverse impact on the Project Companies Projects. In connection with the connection of any Additional Facilities, Manager and/or the Project Company benefitting from such Additional Facilities, shall, to the extent commercially reasonable and subject to Good Utility Practice, schedule and conduct construction activities relating thereto during off-peak and/or low charge/discharge down-time periods including any required disconnection of the Shared Facilities in order to minimize any adverse impact on the Project Companies Projects. 5.6 Disconnection of Shared Facilities. The Manager shall have the power and authority to disconnect the Project of a Project Company from the Shared Facilities (a) pursuant to Sections 9.3 or 9.5 upon liquidation and removal of the Shared Facilities, (b) as provided in Article 10 upon certain defaults hereunder, (c) if necessary, consistent with Good Utility Practice for the Operation and Maintenance of any portion of the Shared Facilities, or (d) if the Manager determines, in its good faith discretion, that disconnection is necessary in the event of an Emergency or to otherwise prevent damage or injury to persons or property, including to the other Projects, the Shared Facilities, the Interconnection Facilities or the property of the Participating Transmission Owner or as otherwise needed to prevent or mitigate technical issues affecting the Shared Facilities, provided that the Manager will use commercially reasonable efforts to give the Project Companies as much advance notice as is reasonably possible under the circumstances, consistent with responding to the Emergency or preventing damage or injury to persons or 20 4919-2205-6789.1
property, or (e) at the direction of the Participating Transmission Owner pursuant to rights under the Interconnection Agreement. Unless the Manager has in its good faith determined that it is unable to do so because an imminent threat of injury or death to persons, or damage to property exists, the Manager shall provide notice to the relevant Project Companies prior to or concurrently with disconnecting its Project from the Shared Facilities or as soon thereafter as is reasonably practical. In the event the Manager determines that any such disconnection is necessary, the Project Companies shall provide to the Manager promptly upon request such Project operational and control data as the Manager may consider necessary to implement such disconnection. 5.7 Books and Records; Reporting Requirements. (a) Maintenance of Records. The Manager shall maintain books and records related to the Shared Facilities in sufficient detail to verify amounts incurred by the Manager and/or due and payable hereunder for a period of not less than three (3) years after the end of the calendar month to which they relate or such longer period as may be required by applicable Governmental Requirements, and all such books and records shall be available for inspection and/or copying by each Party or its authorized representative at the cost and expense of such Party and at reasonable times during regular business hours, upon reasonable notice to the Manager. The costs incurred by the Manager in performing its obligations pursuant to this Section 5.7(a) shall be Shared O&M Expenses and shall be automatically added to the then current Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget if not already included. (b) Provision of Records. The Manager shall, from time to time and at least once every calendar year, provide written reports to the Project Companies sufficient to keep the Project Companies reasonably apprised as to significant matters concerning the maintenance and repair of the Shared Facilities, including such matters related thereto as may have a material impact on the operation, maintenance, and repair of each Project Companys Project. The costs incurred by the Manager in performing its obligations pursuant to this Section 5.7(b) shall be Shared O&M Expenses and shall be automatically added to the then current Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget if not already included. (c) Audits. Each Project Company shall have the right to audit and make copies of the Managers books and records for the Shared Facilities, including with respect to construction costs for the Shared Facilities, any Additional Facilities, and Shared O&M Expenses, during normal business hours and upon reasonable advance notice to the Manager; provided that the Project Company requesting such audit shall be responsible for all costs associated with such audit, including reimbursing the Manager for any costs incurred by the Manager in responding to such request and in the performance of such audit. ARTICLE 6 MANAGER 6.1 Indemnification of the Manager. Each Project Company, severally on a pro rata basis based on its Proportionate Share, shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless the Manager and its shareholders, partners, principals, Affiliates (but not, for purposes of this Section 6.1, any Affiliate that is a Party), officers, directors, employees, agents and representatives, from any claim, 21 4919-2205-6789.1
loss, liability or damage incurred by reason of any act performed or omitted to be performed by it in good faith in performing its obligations under this Agreement, including without limitation, Operation and Maintenance of the Shared Facilities (other than acts or omissions constituting gross negligence, fraud or willful misconduct by the Manager), including reasonable attorneys fees incurred by it in connection with the defense of any action based on any such alleged act or omission. The Manager shall specifically be indemnified by the Project Companies and held harmless from any and all actions taken by the Manager in its reasonable judgment, in good faith, or in reasonable reliance on advice of the Managers attorneys or accountants, and shall be reimbursed by the Project Companies for costs related to claims or litigation which arise in connection with the NCA2 Substation Premises, the Shared Facilities, or this Agreement (other than claims or litigation resulting from the Managers gross negligence, fraud or willful misconduct). 6.2 Liability. Subject to Section 6.4, Manager shall not be liable, responsible or accountable in damages or otherwise to any Project Company or Secured Party for any act performed in good faith by the Manager in the discharge of its duties hereunder as the Manager or in the exercise of its powers and authority hereunder as the Manager, including damages arising out of the disconnection of, or the election not to disconnect, a Project Companys Project from the Shared Facilities, unless such acts or omissions constitute gross negligence, fraud or willful misconduct by the Manager, but such limitation does not limit the right of the Project Companies to declare a Manager Event of Default or remove the Manager for cause. 6.3 Limitation of Liability. In no event shall the liability of the Manager under this Agreement (other than liability arising out of gross negligence, fraud or willful misconduct) exceed, in any calendar year during the term hereof, the greater of (a) actual recoveries with respect to such liability under insurance policies required to be maintained by Manager pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, and (b) an amount equal to $100,000.00.
