IN NO EVENT, WHETHER BASED ON CONTRACT, INDEMNITY, WARRANTY, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) OR OTHERWISE, SHALL THE MANAGER OR ITS RESPECTIVE SUBCONTRACTORS AND SUPPLIERS BE LIABLE FOR SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY, INDIRECT OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION LOSS OF PROFITS OR REVENUE, COST OF CAPITAL, COST OF PURCHASED POWER, OR CLAIMS OF CUSTOMERS OF ANY PROJECT COMPANY FOR SUCH DAMAGES; provided, however, this Section 6.3 shall not be construed as a limitation or restriction on the amount or applicability of any insurance policies or coverages held by or otherwise required to be procured and obtained by the Parties under the terms of this Agreement. 6.4 Indemnification by the Manager. The Manager shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless each Project Company and each of their respective employees and agents, from any claim, loss, liability or damage incurred by reason of any gross negligence, fraud or willful misconduct by the Manager in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement, other than any claim, loss, liability or damage arising due to the gross negligence, fraud, willful misconduct or breach of this Agreement by a Project Company, including reasonable attorneys fees incurred by it in connection with the defense of any action based thereon. 22 4919-2205-6789.1
6.5 Appointment of the Manager. NCA2 shall be and is hereby appointed as the initial Manager and shall hold such position until it (a) resigns, (b) is terminated for cause, or (c) is otherwise removed pursuant to Section 6.6 below. 6.6 Removal of the Manager. The Manager may be removed, as set forth in this Section 6.5. (a) Removal for Cause. The Manager may be removed for cause by a unanimous vote of the Project Companies (excluding, for purposes of such vote, the vote of any Project Company then serving as Manager), provided that each of the following conditions is satisfied: (1) A Manager Event of Default has occurred and is continuing. (2) The Project Company or Project Companies seeking removal of the Manager for cause have provided written notice (the Removal Notice) to the Manager and the other Project Companies of the Manager Event of Default hereunder. Such notice shall contain a reasonably detailed description of the facts and circumstances giving rise to the default and identify a proposed replacement Manager. (3) All necessary consents under the Interconnection Agreements have been obtained. (4) Any dispute regarding the Manager Event of Default has been resolved and the dispute resolution has concluded that there is a Manager Event of Default. (b) Disputes. If any Project Company delivers a Removal Notice pursuant to Section 6.6(a) and the Manager disputes such default, then the following procedures shall apply: (1) Within five (5) Business Days after delivery of the Removal Notice, the Manager shall deliver to the Project Companies a notice with a detailed description of the reasons the Manager disputes such default, and within five (5) Business Days after delivery of such notice by the Manager, the Project Companies and the Manager shall meet and confer in good faith with respect to such default and the cure for such default. Such meeting and conference may be done either by telephone or in person. (2) If, after such meeting and conference, the Manager and the Project Companies cannot agree on whether a default exists, then any Party may submit such dispute to dispute resolution under Article 13. (c) Removal Without Cause. Subject to receipt of all necessary consents under the Interconnection Agreements, Manager may be removed without cause by agreement of all of the Project Companies upon sixty (60) days prior written notice. (d) Successor Manager. No removal of the Manager shall be effective unless and until a successor Manager is appointed. Any Manager which is removed shall, in good faith, continue to undertake its duties and obligations as the Manager until such time as a successor Manager is appointed hereunder. In addition, the incumbent Manager shall cooperate with and 23 4919-2205-6789.1
assist the new Manager during any such transition period, including execution of all necessary documents and provision of all information and documentation that the new Manager may reasonably require to undertake its duties and obligations hereunder. If all of the Project Companies (excluding, for purposes of such vote, any Project Company then serving as Manager and removed pursuant to Section 6.6(a)) fail to agree upon a replacement Manager within sixty (60) days after the decision to remove the Manager, the Project Companies will submit such dispute for resolution pursuant to the dispute resolution procedures set forth in Article 13. 6.7 Resignation. The Manager shall have the right to resign as the Manager upon sixty (60) days written notice to the Project Companies; provided, however, that the Manager may not resign unless all necessary consents under the Interconnection Agreements have been obtained. The Manager shall cooperate with the Project Companies in the transfer of the performance of the Managers obligations to the Project Companies or a third party designated by the Project Companies by the end of such sixty (60) day period, but the Managers resignation shall not be effective until a replacement Manager is appointed. 6.8 Liability. The Manager will be discharged and released from all liability of the Manager accruing or arising under this Agreement on and after the date on which the Manager ceases to serve as Manager; provided, however, that no removal or resignation of the Manager will relieve the Manager of any liability accruing or arising prior to the date on which the Manager ceases to serve as Manager. 6.9 Delegation to Third Parties. The Manager may engage third parties and subcontractors (including the Managers Affiliates) as it deems advisable for the purpose of performing or carrying out any of its obligations under this Agreement; provided, however, that no such engagement shall relieve the Manager of any of its obligations or liabilities under this Agreement. ARTICLE 7 INSURANCE 7.1 Property Insurance. Unless the Parties otherwise agree and subject in any event to Sections 7.9 and 7.10 below, the Manager shall arrange for all risk property insurance during operations for the Shared Facilities and the cost thereof shall be shared borne by NCA2. Each Party, at its discretion, may insure for its own business interruption losses. The all risk property insurance shall be in an amount sufficient to rebuild and replace the Shared Facilities in the event of a property damage loss thereof or damage thereto, including applicable sublimits. The Parties shall, and shall use commercially reasonable efforts to cause their Secured Parties to, cooperate and endorse all loss proceeds checks or waive their requirement to be a loss payee and take all reasonable actions to ensure loss proceeds are processed promptly and in accordance with the intent of this Agreement. Any property insurance procured by the Manager shall be primary as to any other insurance of the Parties and such policy shall waive the right of subrogation against the Parties. Any property insurance procured by a Project Company in lieu of insurance procured and maintained by the Manager pursuant to this Section 7.1 shall be primary as to any other insurance of the Parties and such policy shall waive the right of subrogation against the Parties. 24 4919-2205-6789.1
7.2 Builders All-Risk Insurance/All Risk Property Insurance. Any Party constructing or installing any Shared Facilities or Additional Facilities shall, during such construction or installation, maintain or cause to be maintained builders all-risk insurance in an amount sufficient to replace any part of the Shared Facilities or Additional Facilities that may be affected by the construction. Such policies shall name each of the Parties and their Secured Parties as additional insureds and, to the extent obtainable on commercially reasonable terms, shall provide for thirty (30) days (ten (10) days in the case of non-payment of premiums) prior written notice before cancellation or modification. Once operational, all risk property insurance consistent with industry standards shall be procured to the extent available on commercially reasonable terms. 7.3 Liability Insurance. The Manager shall maintain liability insurance, including general liability coverage, covering the NCA2 Substation Premises and the Shared Facilities, and each Project Company shall maintain liability insurance covering its Project and Property for any activities on the site of its Project or the Shared Facilities Premises. Each Party shall obtain and maintain comprehensive general liability insurance covering liability for bodily injury and death, property damage to third parties and damage to property of third parties in the care, custody and control of any Party and/or their respective employees in connection with operations at such Partys Project and the Shared Facilities. Such coverage shall have a minimum limit of not less than One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence and Ten Million Dollars ($10,000,000) annual aggregate for bodily injury and property damage, provided that such coverage (i) may be provided as part of a blanket policy covering other properties and may be provided by a combination of primary and excess policies, (ii) may be provided through a combination of primary and excess (umbrella) liability insurance policies; (iii) shall comply with any statutory obligation imposed by workers compensation or occupational disease laws, (iv) shall contain a blanket broad form contractual endorsement and severability of interest clause, and (v) shall designate the Parties, the Secured Parties, and their officers, directors, employees and agents as additional insureds. If a policy described above is on a claims made basis, the retroactive date of the policy shall be the Effective Date. Furthermore, if a policy is on a claims made basis, such coverage shall survive the termination of this Agreement until the expiration of the maximum statutory period of limitations in the State of California for actions based on contract or in tort. If coverage is on an occurrence basis, insurance on an occurrence basis shall be maintained for the term of this Agreement. 7.4 Workers Compensation. The Parties shall each obtain and maintain minimum coverage to comply with any statutory obligation imposed by workers compensation or occupational disease laws to the extent the Party uses its employees to perform duties under this Agreement. In the event the Party retains a subcontractor to perform any of such duties, it shall require such Person to comply with the requirements of this Section 7.4. 7.5 Automobile Liability. The Parties shall each also obtain and maintain an automobile liability insurance in the amounts they maintain for their other operations covering bodily injury and property damage, for hired, owned (if any) and non-owned vehicles to the extent their operations under this Agreement contemplate use of hired, owned and non-owned vehicles. 7.6 Casualty Event. In the event of a casualty that affects any of the Shared Facilities, all insurance proceeds with respect to the Shared Facilities shall be applied to reconstruction of the affected Shared Facilities. If there is uninsured loss or insurance proceeds are inadequate, the 25 4919-2205-6789.1
Parties shall contribute additional amounts based on their Proportionate Shares; provided that amounts due with respect to any claims arising from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of a Party shall be first fully allocated to the account of such Party and then any balance not arising from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of such Party being contributed by the Parties based on their Proportionate Shares. In the event of any liability claim relating to any of the NCA Substation Premises or Shared Facilities, to the extent such claim is not covered by the insurance required pursuant to this Article 7, the Parties shall be responsible for such claim based on their Proportionate Shares; provided that amounts due with respect to any claims arising from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of a Party shall be first fully allocated to the account of such Party and then any balance not arising from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of such Party being contributed by the Parties based on their Proportionate Shares. 7.7 Form and Content of Insurance. All policies and binders with respect to insurance provided pursuant to this Article 7 shall be as follows: (a) Form of Policies. All insurance provided for hereunder shall be placed on forms reasonably acceptable to the Parties and the Secured Parties. (b) Insurance Companies. All insurance required hereunder shall be with insurers with an A.M. Best rating of A minus or better or with insurers otherwise deemed acceptable to the Parties, and the Secured Parties (acting reasonably). (c) Severability. All liability insurance shall contain a severability of interest provision providing that, except with respect to the total limits of liability, the insurance shall apply to each insured or additional insured in the same manner as if separate policies had been issued to each. (d) Non-Recourse. All insurance shall provide that there will be no recourse against the additional insureds for the payment of premiums or commissions or (if such policies provide for the payment thereof) additional premiums or assessments. 7.8 Additional Requirements. (a) Waiver of Subrogation. To the extent allowed by law, all insurance maintained by the Parties shall provide for the waiver of any right of subrogation by the insurers thereunder against the Parties and their Secured Parties and their officers, directors, employees, agents and representatives, and any right of the insurers to any setoff or counterclaim or any other deduction, whether by attachment or otherwise, in respect of any liability of any such person insured under such policy. (b) Non-Vitiation. To the extent obtainable on commercially reasonable terms, all property insurance maintained by the Parties shall provide for the waiver of any right of the insurers to terminate, repudiate, rescind or avoid this insurance as against any insured or any agent of any insured on the grounds that the risk or claim was not adequately disclosed, or that it was in any way misrepresented, or increased, or that any term, condition or warranty was breached, or on the ground of negligence, unless deliberate or fraudulent non-disclosure or misrepresentation or breach by that insured is established in relation thereto. 26 4919-2205-6789.1
(c) Notice of Cancellation. To the extent obtainable on commercially reasonable terms, all insurance shall provide that it may not be canceled or materially changed without at least thirty (30) days prior written notification thereof, except in cases of non-payment of premium for which ten (10) days prior written notice shall be provided. (d) Certificates; Proof of Loss. Prior to any construction activities within the NCA2 Substation Premises by a Party, such Party shall furnish certificates of insurance to the other Parties evidencing the insurance required of such Party pursuant to this Agreement. The Party maintaining each policy hereunder shall make all proofs of loss under each such policy, and shall take all other action reasonably required to ensure collection from insurers for any loss under any such policy, except that the other Party shall cooperate and assist in the preparation of such proofs of loss and take such other actions on behalf of the Parties as may be requested by the Parties. (e) Payment of Deductibles and Self-Insured Retention Amounts. Each Project Company shall be responsible for deductibles or self-insured retention under such Project Companys insurance policies. Any deductibles or self-insured retentions under policies obtained by the Manager pursuant to this Agreement shall be paid by the Project Companies as a Shared O&M Expense. (f) Subcontractor Insurance. Any Party performing work on the NCA2 Substation Premises or the Shared Facilities shall require all contractors and subcontractors to carry commercial general liability insurance, automobile liability insurance and employers liability insurance in the amount of at least One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) each and workers compensation insurance as required by law, and shall furnish the Manager with certificates of such insurance, prior to entry on the NCA2 Substation Premises and during the time in which they are engaged in performing any services. (g) Notification. Each Party agrees to advise the other Parties as soon as practicable in writing of any notice of claim in excess of Ten Thousand Dollars ($10,000) to which insurance pursuant to this Article 7 applies. (h) Failure To Procure. Should the Manager fail to provide or maintain any of the insurance policies required of it with respect to the NCA2 Substation Premises or Shared Facilities, the Project Companies shall have the right to provide and/or maintain such coverage after a reasonable time to cure has passed. Any cost incurred by a Project Company in so doing shall be reimbursed to such Project Company, and paid by all of the Project Companies as a Shared O&M Expense. (i) Allocation of Costs. All premiums for insurance obtained by the Manager shall be considered Shared O&M Expenses for purposes of this Agreement. 7.9 Limitation on Insurance Requirements. (a) Notwithstanding anything in this Article 7 to the contrary, if insurance meeting the requirements set forth herein is not available on commercially reasonable terms, then the Manager shall obtain such insurance on terms in accordance with the requirements of this Article 7 to the extent, if any, such insurance is available on commercially reasonably terms, as 27 4919-2205-6789.1
certified by the Manager to the Parties. Any Project Company shall have the right, at its sole cost and expense, to obtain insurance with respect to such Project Companys Proportionate Share for its own account and/or for the benefit of its Secured Party to the extent the Manager cannot obtain such insurance. (b) Insurance obtained by the Manager or a Project Company pursuant to any Interconnection Agreement or Revenue Agreement may, if it meets the minimum requirement of this Article 7 satisfy a Partys insurance obligations under this Agreement. 7.10 Right to Self-Insure. Notwithstanding anything in this Article 7 to the contrary, unless otherwise prohibited by the Interconnection Agreements or any Revenue Agreement of a Project Company, the Manager shall have the option to self-insure for the insurance it is required to obtain and maintain hereunder on such terms and conditions as all of the Parties may mutually agree. ARTICLE 8 ASSIGNMENTS AND RIGHT TO ENCUMBER 8.1 Assignment by Parties. No Party shall assign, sell, dispose of, give or otherwise transfer (collectively assign or assignment) its rights and interests under this Agreement, to any person, except with the consent of the other Parties or as provided in Section 4.7, Section 8.3, or Section 9.2. If the procedures provided in Section 8.2 are complied with, the assigning Party shall be released from any further obligations hereunder arising from and after the effective date of such assignment (to the extent of the interest assigned), and such assignee shall become a Party under this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, (a) the sale or other transfer of ownership interests in any Project Company (or any of its constituent members, partners or upstream parents) in connection with any sale, merger, reorganization, foreclosure or tax equity financing that does not involve an assignment of this Agreement, (b) any assignment by a Project Company of its rights under this Agreement to the entity into which or with which such Project Company may be merged or consolidated, or (c) any assignment by a Project Company of all of its rights under this Agreement to any Qualified Transferee to which such Project Company transfers all or substantially all of its Project, shall each be expressly permitted hereunder without the consent of the other Parties; provided that any such assignee, transferee or successor entity shall comply with the requirements of Section 8.2. Any attempted assignment of any interest in the Shared Facilities or this Agreement made other than in accordance with this Section 8.1, either voluntarily or by operation of law, will be void and of no force or effect whatsoever. 8.2 Procedures. No Party shall be bound by any assignment, no assignment shall be valid, and no assignee of any Partys rights under this Agreement shall become a Party unless (a) all Parties consent to the assignment to the extent required by Section 8.1; (b) the assignee will own and operate the Project of the assigning Party; (c) the assignee promptly cures any outstanding breaches or defaults of the assigning Party that are capable of being cured, (d) the assignee agrees in writing, in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to the other Parties, to assume all of the present and future obligations of the assigning Party under this Agreement with respect to the Project being transferred and to be bound by the terms of this Agreement in the place and stead of 28 4919-2205-6789.1
the assigning Party, to the extent of the interest assigned, and (e) a counterpart of the instrument of assignment, executed by the parties thereto, is delivered to the other Parties. 8.3 Right to Encumber. (a) Amendment of Agreement in Connection with Project Company Financing. The Parties acknowledge that a Project Company may finance all or part of its costs in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement. In the event that a Project Company does enter into such financing, the Parties acknowledge and agree that certain aspects of the transactions contemplated hereby may need to be modified in certain respects to accommodate the reasonable requirements of any lender with respect to such financing. The Parties hereby agree to cooperate in good faith and to use commercially reasonable efforts to assist a Project Company to make or to obtain any modification of this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby reasonably requested by a Project Company to allow the Project Company to obtain such financing upon commercially reasonable terms, including obtaining consents to the assignment for security purposes of a Project Companys Proportionate Share interest in the Shared Facilities reasonably requested by such Project Companys lender, provided that the Parties will not be required to cooperate with a Project Company to implement any modification which would (i) relieve such Project Company of any of its obligations under this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby, (ii) decrease the economic benefits or increase the costs of the transactions contemplated hereby to any of the other Parties, or (iii) create any additional economic or legal risks to any of the other Parties or any of their respective Affiliates. The Project Company seeking the financing will be responsible for the reasonable attorneys fees and other out-of-pocket costs incurred by the other Parties in providing such cooperation and efforts under this Section 8.3. (b) Right to Encumber. So long as such actions do not violate, result in breach of, or cause the loss or termination of the Interconnection Agreements, any NCA2 Substation Premises Property Right, or any Revenue Agreement, each Party specifically agrees that (i) any Project Company may at any time pledge, collaterally assign, encumber, or grant a security interest in the entirety of its rights under this Agreement to any Secured Party concurrently with pledging, collaterally assigning, encumbering or granting a security interest in such Project Companys Project to such Secured Party and (ii) it will execute such consents to collateral assignment as may be reasonably requested by a Project Company or that Project Companys Secured Parties confirming, among other things, (A) the Project Companys right to the Shared Facilities Services, (B) that there are no known Project Company defaults under this Agreement, and (iii) the Shared Facilities capital costs paid to date. (c) Pledge, Collateral Assignment or Encumbrance. Should a Project Company pledge, collaterally assign or encumber its rights under this Agreement as provided in Section 8.3(b) above, the Parties hereto expressly agree between themselves and for the benefit of any Secured Party that (i) no Party shall amend this Agreement in any material respect unless the consent of all the Secured Parties is first obtained, (ii) upon the occurrence of a default by a Project Company hereunder, the non-defaulting Party declaring the default shall also provide written notice to the defaulting Partys Secured Parties of such default (and accept their cure of such default on the terms set forth herein), (iii) each such Secured Party shall have the same period after receipt of a notice of default to cure, or cause to be cured, the default described therein, as is given 29 4919-2205-6789.1
to the defaulting Party, plus, in each instance, any additional cure periods provided under the Security Documents, not to exceed (a) thirty (30) days in the event of any monetary default; and (b) sixty (60) days in the event of any non-monetary default; provided, however, that such sixty (60)-day period shall be extended for the time reasonably required by the Secured Party to complete such cure (not to exceed one hundred twenty (120) days in the aggregate), so long as the Secured Party is diligently pursuing such cure, and (iv) in case of the bankruptcy, insolvency or appointment of a receiver in bankruptcy for a Project Company (the Insolvent Party), if this Agreement is terminated with respect to the Insolvent Party or rejected in such proceeding, the other Parties (the Solvent Parties) shall upon written request of the first priority Secured Party of the Insolvent Party, within thirty (30) days after the Secured Party obtains possession or control of the assets of the Insolvent Party, accept such Secured Party, or its designee or assignee, as a Party to this Agreement or enter into a new shared facilities agreement with respect to the Shared Facilities with such Secured Party, or its designee or assignee, within twenty (20) days after the receipt of such request. Such new Shared Facilities agreement shall be effective as of the date of the termination of this Agreement by reason of default by the Insolvent Party or upon the date of rejection of this Agreement by the Insolvent Party in its bankruptcy proceeding, on the same terms, covenants, conditions and agreements as contained in this Agreement. Upon the acceptance of the Secured Party, or its designee or assignee, as a Party hereunder, or upon execution of any such new Shared Facilities agreement, the Secured Parties, or their designees or assignees, of the Insolvent Party shall (A) pay the Solvent Parties any unpaid amounts which are due the Solvent Parties from the Insolvent Party under the terms of this Agreement, and (B) promptly perform or cause to be performed all of the other covenants and agreements set forth in this Agreement to be performed by the Insolvent Party to the extent that the Insolvent Party failed to perform the same prior to the execution and delivery of the new Shared Facilities agreement. A Secured Party shall only be liable under this Agreement only to the extent of its interest in the Insolvent Partys Project and other assets. (d) Rights of Secured Parties. All rights and interests in a Project Companys rights to the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights and the Shared Facilities acquired by a Secured Party, whether through foreclosure of a Secured Partys lien and security interests, by conveyance in lieu of foreclosure or otherwise, shall be acquired subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. (e) Estoppel Certificates. Within a reasonable period of time following receipt of a written request from a Party, its Secured Party or a purchaser of a Project or an ownership interest in a Party, each Party shall deliver to the requesting party estoppel certificates certifying (i) whether this Agreement has been supplemented, amended, assigned, or subleased and, if so, the substance and manner thereof, (ii) the validity and force and effect of this Agreement, (iii) the absence or existence of any known default under this Agreement, (iv) the commencement and expiration dates of this Agreement, (v) the rights of the Secured Party under this Agreement, and (vi) any other matters as may be reasonably requested by the Secured Party. 8.4 Expenses. All reasonable expenses, including reasonable attorneys fees, incurred by the Parties in connection with (a) the assignment or proposed assignment of a Partys rights under this Agreement, or (b) the actual or proposed pledge, collateral assignment, encumbrance, or grant of a security interest in a Partys rights under this Agreement to a Secured Party, shall be promptly paid by the assigning/borrowing Party to the respective Parties upon request therefor. 30 4919-2205-6789.1
8.5 FERC Approval. Notwithstanding anything in this Article 8 to the contrary, if FERC approval is required for a transfer of a Partys interest hereunder, no Party may transfer its interests in this Agreement, and no purported transfer will be effective, unless and until such Party has obtained all necessary approvals from FERC to effectuate any changes in this Agreement to reflect such transfer and the changes in the Parties to this Agreement, to the extent required by FERC. 8.6 Further Assurances. In the event of an assignment or transfer in part by a Party pursuant to Section 8.1 above, the Parties shall, at the reasonable request and expense of the assigning Party, execute and deliver a separate agreement with such assignee together with any necessary amendment to this Agreement, such that this Agreement, as amended, and such separate agreement shall cumulatively allocate the respective rights of the assigning Party and the assignee following such assignment; provided that in no event shall such amendment or separate agreement increase any obligation or liability of any of the other Parties or otherwise adversely impact such Parties rights in and to the NCA2 Substation Premises and the Shared Facilities under this Agreement, without the express consent of such Party thereto. ARTICLE 9 TERM AND TERMINATION 9.1 Term and Termination. The term of this Agreement shall commence as of the Effective Date and shall terminate, subject to obtaining any necessary prior FERC approvals for such termination, upon the mutual agreement of all of the Parties, with the consent of the then-existing Secured Parties, if applicable. If applicable, upon such termination, the Parties shall execute and record a notice of such termination with a reference to the Memorandum, if any such Memorandum was recorded. 9.2 Termination as to a Project Company: Surrender of Interests. Any Project Company may elect to surrender all of its interests hereunder and in and to the Shared Facilities and to assign its rights hereunder to the other Project Company, but only with the consent of the other Project Company, and, thereupon, to cease to have any right, title or interest in this Agreement and the Shared Facilities; provided that (a) the Surrendering Party executes and delivers all instruments of transfer as may be necessary or appropriate to effect (and that do effect) the assignment of such rights to the other Project Company, in form and substance reasonably acceptable to the other Project Company, (b) the Surrendering Party is not then in default of its obligations under this Agreement or the other Project Company to which such rights are being assigned have agreed in writing to promptly cure such defaults, and (c) each Secured Party that holds a security interest in such rights has consented in writing to such surrender and assignment and has released or agreed to release such Secured Partys security interest in the interests being assigned and the Shared Facilities. The Surrendering Party shall remain fully responsible for, and shall pay (i) its applicable Proportionate Share of all Shared O&M Expenses and other obligations and liabilities hereunder through the effective date of its surrender and assignment, (ii) its applicable Proportionate Share of the Additional Facilities Construction Costs (to the extent any Additional Facilities have been constructed prior to such surrender and assignment), and (iii) if applicable, the Panwest Project Shared Facilities Construction Costs. In addition, the Surrendering Party shall be responsible for obtaining any FERC approval required for the transfer and all costs 31 4919-2205-6789.1
associated with obtaining such rights. Notwithstanding anything contained herein or in the Thermal Lease to the contrary, upon expiration or earlier termination of the Thermal Lease, (i) NCA2 shall not remove any Existing NCA2 Project Shared Facilities, Shared Facilities, Additional Facilities, or Disapproved Additional Facilities owned in whole or in part by NCA2 (the NCA2 Facilities) from the NCA2 Substation Premises, and (ii) NCA2 shall transfer its ownership in and to the NCA2 Facilities to Panwest such that the NCA2 Facilities are deemed to be Improvements (as such term is defined in the Gen-Tie Easement) under the Gen-Tie Easement by executing and delivering all instruments of transfer as may be necessary or appropriate to effect (and that do effect) the assignment of such ownership rights to Panwest, in form and substance reasonably acceptable to Panwest 9.3 Abandonment or Decommissioning of a Project. In addition to the obligations set forth in Section 7 and Section 9.2, in the event a Surrendering Party desires to decommission and/or abandon its Project, the Surrendering Party shall, upon notice to the other Parties of its intent to decommission and/or abandon its Project, be responsible for the removal of any Shared Facilities that are no longer required by the remaining Parties for the continued operation of the non-Surrendering Partys Project or the Shared Facilities due to the decommissioning and/or abandonment of the Surrendering Partys Project, and upon the failure of the Surrendering Party to remove or release same, the Manager may remove or release same on behalf of such Surrendering Party and shall charge the Surrendering Party all costs incurred to accomplish such removal or release, plus ten percent (10%) of such costs for the services of the Manager in procuring and supervising such work. In addition, the Surrendering Party shall be responsible for and shall pay its Proportionate Share of all Shared O&M Expenses and other obligations and liabilities hereunder through the effective date of abandonment; the Surrendering Party shall further remain fully responsible for, and shall pay (i) its Proportionate Share of all Shared O&M Expenses and other obligations and liabilities hereunder through the effective date of its surrender and assignment, (ii) its applicable Proportionate Share of the Additional Facilities Construction Costs (to the extent any Additional Facilities have been constructed prior to such surrender and assignment), and (iii) and (ii) if applicable, the Panwest Project Shared Facilities Construction Costs. 9.4 Cooperation Upon Surrender, Abandonment and/or Decommissioning of a Project. The Parties recognize that the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights exist because of the existing rights of a Project Company pursuant to a separate agreement between that Project Company and a third party. If, after receiving notice from a Surrendering Party that it intends to surrender its interests or intends to abandon or decommission its Project, the remaining Project Company will review the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights to determine whether such surrender, abandonment or decommissioning will cause the termination or expiration of any necessary NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights. If the remaining Project Company reasonably determines that, by virtue of the Surrendering Partys surrender of its interests and/or abandonment or decommissioning, necessary NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights may be terminated or may expire, the Surrendering Party shall use commercially reasonable efforts to cooperate with the remaining Project Company and the Manager to obtain replacement agreements with such third party so that the Project Company has all rights necessary for this Agreement to remain in full force and effect so that the remaining Project Company continues to enjoy the full benefits of this Agreement pursuant to the purposes stated herein, and the Surrendering Party may 32 4919-2205-6789.1
not surrender, abandon and/or decommission such Project until such NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights have been secured for the other Project Company. 9.5 Distribution on Termination of this Agreement. In the event that the Project Companies decide to decommission all of the Projects and to proceed with the removal of the Shared Facilities, the Manager shall take account of the Shared Facilities, and any other assets or liabilities related thereto, and after obtaining any necessary FERC approvals, shall proceed with the liquidation thereof. The assets shall be liquidated under the supervision of the Manager as promptly as is consistent with obtaining a reasonable value therefor, and the proceeds therefrom, together with any assets distributed in-kind, shall be applied and distributed as follows: 9.5.1 To the payment of debts and liabilities of the Parties to third parties in connection with the Shared Facilities which are then due and the expenses of liquidation (including expenses incurred by the Manager) on a pro-rata and pari passu basis, based upon each Project Companys Proportionate Share as of the date of liquidation. 9.5.2 To the setting up of any reserves which the Manager deems reasonably necessary for any contingent or unforeseen liabilities or obligations or debts not yet payable by the Parties in connection with the Shared Facilities, including any reserves to pay costs associated with the decommissioning and removal of the Shared Facilities, provided that any Party may elect to Dispute, and to submit to arbitration, the amount determined by the Manager for any such reserves pursuant to Section 13.2 below. 9.5.3 Any sum remaining shall be distributed on a pro-rata basis to the Project Companies, based upon each Project Companys Proportionate Share as of the date of final termination of this Agreement. 9.5.4 The Manager shall thereupon have the right, to disconnect the Shared Facilities from the Interconnection Facilities and the Projects, subject to obtaining any FERC approvals necessary for such actions. 9.6 Valuation and Distribution of Non-Cash Distributions. To the extent that non-cash consideration is distributed in kind as permitted herein, the fair market value of such assets shall first be determined by an independent valuation expert selected by the Parties, including separate valuations for the Shared Facilities, and the distribution of assets shall be made in accordance with such valuation. ARTICLE 10 DEFAULT AND REMEDIES 10.1 Project Company Default. A Project Company (for the avoidance of doubt, not in its capacity as Manager, as applicable) shall be in default under this Agreement if such Project Company (each of the following constituting a Project Company Event of Default): (a) Fails to pay when due any amounts required to be paid by such Project Company under the terms of this Agreement and such failure to pay is not cured within thirty (30) 33 4919-2205-6789.1
days following written notice from the Manager or another Party to whom such amount is owed specifying the amount to be paid; (b) Except as provided in Sections 4.4 and 9.4, permits a separate agreement to which it is a party to expire prior to the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement, and the expiration of such agreement would jeopardize the validity or enforceability of this Agreement; (c) Breaches, or causes the breach of a NCA2 Substation Premises Property Right and fails to cure such breach within the time permitted by such NCA2 Substation Premises Property Right, after receipt of a notice of default from the Manager to cure, or cause to be cured, the default described therein, as is given to the defaulting Party less, in each instance, the following reduced time periods: (i) five (5) days less than the specified cure period under the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Right in the event of any monetary default; and (ii) ten (10) days less than the specified cure period under the NCA2 Substation Premises Property Right in the event of any non-monetary default. Each of the Parties agrees to provide a copy of any notice of default under a NCA2 Substation Premises Property Right that is received by such Party to the other Parties and their Secured Parties under this Agreement within forty-eight (48) hours of receiving such notice of default or breach, regardless of the Party or the contract that is alleged in the notice to be in default or to have breached; (d) Breaches or causes the breach of its applicable Interconnection Agreement, and such defaulting Project Company fails to cure such breach by the time that is ten (10) days less than the specified cure period under the applicable Interconnection Agreement, provided that in no event shall the resulting cure period available to the Project Company be less than five (5) Business Days. Each of the Parties agrees to provide a copy of any notice of default received by them to the other Parties and their Secured Parties under this Agreement within forty-eight (48) hours of receiving such notice of default, regardless of the party or the contract that is alleged to be in default in the notice; (e) Fails to cure any other failure to perform any obligation under this Agreement not covered in the preceding clauses (a) through (d) within thirty (30) days following written notice from any other Party specifying the nature of the failure to perform, provided that if the default is not reasonably capable of being cured within thirty (30) days, then the default shall be deemed cured if the defaulting Project Company commences, diligently pursues, and completes action that remedies the default within ninety (90) days of receipt of such notice; or (f) Makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors, files a petition in bankruptcy, voluntarily takes advantage of any bankruptcy or insolvency laws or is otherwise adjudicated bankrupt or judicially insolvent, in each case, immediately upon such occurrence or, if a petition or an answer is filed proposing the adjudication of such Project Company as bankrupt, when such Project Company shall consent to the filing thereof or sixty (60) days after the filing thereof unless the same shall have been discharged, opposed, or denied prior thereto. A copy of any notice of a Project Company default or Project Company Event of Default shall be provided, to the extent required pursuant to this Section 10.1, to any Secured Party in accordance with Section 8.3(c), and the non-defaulting Parties shall accept curative performance from any such Secured Party in accordance with Section 8.3(c). Notwithstanding anything to the contrary 34 4919-2205-6789.1
in this Section 10.1, a non-defaulting Party shall not be required to provide notice to a Secured Party unless the defaulting Project Company has, prior to the occurrence of the relevant underlying default, provided each of the Manager and the other Project Companies written notice of the name of such Secured Party and a contact person, address, telephone, facsimile number (if available) and email address for a single representative or agent of the Secured Parties of such defaulting Project Company designated to receive such notices. 10.2 Manager Event of Default. The Manager shall be in default under this Agreement if the Manager (each of the following constituting a Manager Event of Default): (a) Fails to pay when due any amounts required to be paid by the Manager under the terms of this Agreement and such failure to pay is not cured within thirty (30) days following written notice from another Party to whom such amount is owed specifying the amount to be paid; (b) Makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors, files a petition in bankruptcy, voluntarily takes advantage of any bankruptcy or insolvency laws or is otherwise adjudicated bankrupt or judicially insolvent, in each case, immediately upon such occurrence or, if a petition or an answer is filed proposing the adjudication of the Manager as bankrupt, when the Manager shall consent to the filing thereof or sixty (60) days after the filing thereof unless the same shall have been discharged, opposed, or denied prior thereto; (c) Fails to cure a default by Manager under either the O&M Agreement within fifteen (15) days after its occurrence, in the case of a default that can be cured by the payment of money, or forty-five (45) days after its occurrence, in the case of a default that cannot be cured solely by the payment of money; or (d) Fails to perform any other material covenant or obligation under this Agreement not covered by the foregoing clauses (a) through (c) within thirty (30) days following written notice from any Party specifying the nature of the failure to perform, provided that if the default is not reasonably capable of being cured within thirty (30) days, Manager shall have such additional period, not to exceed an additional sixty (60) days, to cure such failure. 10.3 Remedies. (a) Default by a Project Company. Upon the occurrence and during the continuation of a Project Company Event of Default, the non-defaulting Parties shall have the following remedies: (1) In their sole and absolute discretion, to cure the default of the defaulting Party by making or tendering the required payment or performance, and permitting the defaulting Partys Project to continue to have the use of the Shared Facilities Services, provided that any such amounts paid by the non-defaulting Parties, including all reasonable attorneys fees and costs, shall be treated as a loan to the defaulting Party, which loan shall accrue interest until repaid in full at the Default Interest Rate; 35 4919-2205-6789.1
(2) To disconnect the defaulting Project Companys Project, provided, that (A) the Manager shall have in good faith determined that bringing an action for money damages and/or for specific performance will not provide an adequate or timely remedy for such default, and (B) the non-defaulting Project Companies shall have consented in writing to such disconnection; provided, further that the defaulting Project Company shall be permitted to reconnect promptly when and if the default is cured, any necessary approvals from the Participating Transmission Owner have been obtained, and in the case of any such reconnection, the non-defaulting Project Company and the Manager shall have been compensated in full for any and all damage incurred by them as a result of such Project Company Event of Default; (3) To bring an action to specifically enforce the provisions of this Agreement; (4) To bring an action for money damages or other appropriate relief; or (5) To exercise any other rights and remedies which the non-defaulting Parties might have at law or in equity, other than termination of this Agreement. (b) Default by the Manager. Upon the occurrence and during the continuation of a Manager Event of Default, each Project Company shall have the following remedies: (1) To remove the Manager for cause pursuant to the procedures set forth in Section 6.6 of this Agreement; (2) To bring an action to specifically enforce the provisions of this Agreement; (3) In their sole and absolute discretion, to cure the default of the Manager by making or tendering the required performance or payment (in accordance with such Project Companys Proportionate Share or in full, at its election), provided that any such amounts paid by the Project Companies, including all reasonable attorneys fees and costs, shall be treated as a loan to the Manager, which loan shall accrue interest until repaid in full at the Default Interest Rate; and (4) To exercise any and all other rights and remedies that any one or more of the Project Companies might otherwise have at law or in equity, other than the termination of this Agreement. (c) Cumulative Remedies; Specific Performance. All of the foregoing remedies are cumulative and non-exclusive, and the exercise of any one remedy at any one time shall not constitute the waiver of any other remedy at a later or different time. In addition, the Parties agree that damages may not be an adequate remedy for a default under this Agreement, and that a non-defaulting Party will be entitled to seek specific performance, injunctive or other equitable relief against the defaulting Party in order to prevent or eliminate such default or to exercise the non-defaulting Partys remedies under this Agreement on account of such default. 36 4919-2205-6789.1
10.4 Waiver of Right to Partition or Distribution. Each Party acknowledges and agrees that it would be prejudicial to the interests of the Parties under this Agreement if any Party were to seek partition or any other type of division of the Shared Facilities, the Additional Facilities or any other shared rights, assets or properties, or to file an action for such partition or division. Therefore, in consideration of such fact and for other good and valuable consideration, each of the Parties hereby waives and relinquishes any and all rights that it may have to seek a partition or any other type of division of any rights or interests in the Shared Facilities, the Additional Facilities, or any other shared rights, assets or properties that are subject to this Agreement. ARTICLE 11 REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES 11.1 Representations and Warranties of Parties. Each Party represents and warrants for the benefit of the other Parties, that: (a) It is a limited liability company or partnership (as the case may be), duly organized and existing in good standing under the laws of the state of its formation, qualified to do business in the State of Nevada, and has the requisite power and authority to enter into this Agreement. (b) This Agreement has been duly authorized and constitutes the legal, valid and binding obligation of it, enforceable against it in accordance with its terms; and the execution and delivery of this Agreement and performance of its obligations hereunder will not require the approval of any Governmental Authority and will not contravene, conflict with or result in the breach or violation of any document to which it is bound or in any law, rule or regulation. (c) It possesses all requisite power and authority to perform this Agreement and to carry out the transactions contemplated herein. (d) No suit, action or arbitration, or legal, administrative or other proceeding is pending or, to its knowledge, threatened against it that would affect the validity or enforceability of this Agreement or the ability of it to fulfill its obligations and commitments hereunder. ARTICLE 12 INDEMNITY 12.1 Indemnity by the Project Companies. Each Project Company shall fully indemnify, save harmless and defend the other Project Company, each of their contractors and subcontractors, each of their subsidiaries and Affiliates, and the directors, officers, shareholders, members, managers, agents, employees, successors and permitted assigns of each of them (the Indemnified Parties), from and against any and all liability arising from third party claims, suits, losses, costs, damages, injuries, liabilities, demands, penalties, interest and causes of action, including without limitation reasonable attorneys fees (collectively, the Damages), arising in connection with Shared Facilities Services, the NCA2 Substation Premises, and/or the Shared Facilities or otherwise resulting from, or related to this Agreement, including without limitation any damage to 37 4919-2205-6789.1
or destruction of property of, or death of or bodily injury to, any Person (whether they are employees of the Indemnified Parties or any contractor or subcontractor, or are persons unaffiliated with the Shared Facilities) to the extent the Damages are caused by the gross negligence, fraud or willful misconduct of, or breach of this Agreement or any NCA2 Substation Premises Property Rights by, such Project Company, and if the claim or cause of action has arisen (i) prior to the termination, expiration or completion of this Agreement or with respect to a Surrendering Party, prior to the effective date of its surrender pursuant to Sections 4.7 or 9.2 or (ii) within three (3) years thereafter. It is expressly agreed that where the Indemnified Parties are contributorily negligent, such contributory negligence will not preclude recovery under this Article 12, but such recovery will not include Damages to the extent caused by such contributory negligence. The Project Companies aforesaid indemnity is for the exclusive benefit of the applicable Indemnified Parties and in no event shall inure to the benefit of any other party. 12.2 Indemnity Notice. The Project Company seeking indemnity is hereinafter referred to as the Indemnitee and the Project Company against whom indemnity is sought is hereinafter referred to as the Indemnitor. An Indemnitee shall, within ten (10) Business Days of the receipt of notice of the commencement of any legal action or of any claims against such Indemnitee in respect of which indemnification will be sought, notify Indemnitor in writing thereof. Failure of the Indemnitee to give such notice will reduce the liability of Indemnitor by the amount of damages solely attributable to the failure of the Indemnitee to give such timely notice to Indemnitor but the failure to so notify shall not otherwise relieve Indemnitor from any liability which it may have to such Indemnitee under the indemnity agreements contained in this Article 12 or otherwise. In case any such claim or legal action shall be made or brought against an Indemnitee and such Indemnitee shall notify Indemnitor thereof, Indemnitor may, or if so requested by such Indemnitee shall, assume the defense thereof, with a reservation of rights, with counsel reasonably satisfactory to such Indemnitee, and after notice from Indemnitor to such Indemnitee of an election to assume the defense thereof and approval by the Indemnitee of such counsel, will not be liable to such Indemnitee under this Article 12 for any legal fees and expenses subsequently incurred by such Indemnitee in connection with the defense thereof. No Indemnitee shall settle any indemnified claim over which Indemnitor has not been afforded the opportunity to assume the defense without Indemnitors approval, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld. Indemnitor shall control the settlement of all claims over which it has assumed the defense; provided, however, that Indemnitor shall not conclude any settlement (i) which requires any action or forbearance from action by Indemnitee or any of its Affiliates without the prior approval of Indemnitee, and (ii) unless such settlement includes a provision unconditionally releasing Indemnitee from all liability in respect of such claims or proceedings and does not contain any factual or legal admission by or with respect to such Indemnitee. The Indemnitee shall provide reasonable assistance to Indemnitor at Indemnitors expense in connection with such legal action or claim. If Indemnitor has not employed counsel to conduct the defense of any such claim or action within a reasonable time after notice of assertion of such claim or of commencement of such action, legal and other expenses, including the expenses of separate counsel, incurred by such Indemnitee shall be borne by Indemnitor. In all cases the Indemnitee shall have the right to participate in and be represented by counsel of its own choice and at its own expense in any such legal action or with respect to any claim and the Indemnitee shall have the right to be represented by separate counsel at the expense of the Indemnitor if the named parties to such action include both such Indemnitee and the Indemnitor and the claims or defenses which Indemnitee chooses to assert are conflicting or 38 4919-2205-6789.1
inconsistent with the claims or defenses that Indemnitor chooses to assert or the use of counsel chosen by Indemnitor would otherwise present such counsel with a conflict of interest. 12.3 Employees. Neither of the Project Companies nor any of their directors, officers, employees, agents, Affiliates or representatives, nor any independent subcontractors engaged by any of them in connection with the performance of this Agreement, shall be deemed an employee of the other Project Company. Neither of the Project Companies shall bring any claim against any other Project Company or any of their directors, officers, Affiliates, agents, representatives, employees or independent subcontractors with respect to any liability for compensation under an applicable statute or any applicable governmental rule for workers compensation, if applicable, and/or employers liability claims of employees. 12.4 Net Amount. In the event that any Indemnitor is obligated to indemnify and hold any Indemnitee harmless under this Article 12, the amount owing to the Indemnitee shall be the amount of such Indemnitees actual out-of-pocket loss, net of any insurance proceeds received by such Indemnitee or any payments received by such Indemnitee on account of the matters indemnified from another source. ARTICLE 13 DISPUTE RESOLUTION 13.1 Disputes. In the event a dispute arises between or among the Parties regarding the application or interpretation of any provision of this Agreement (Dispute), the aggrieved Party shall promptly notify the other Parties of the Dispute in writing, and thereafter, each Party shall direct its Party Representative to confer and negotiate in good faith with the other Party Representatives for a period of fifteen (15) Business Days to resolve such Dispute. If the Parties shall have failed to resolve the Dispute to their mutual satisfaction within said fifteen (15) Business Day period, each Party shall have the right to pursue the resolution of such dispute in accordance with the provisions of Section 13.2. 13.2 Dispute Resolution. 13.2.1 General Disputes. (a) Any controversy, claim or dispute between or among the Parties arising out of or related to this Agreement or the breach thereof, or regarding the application or interpretation of any provision of this Agreement, that is not a Technical Dispute and that cannot be settled amicably by the Parties will be submitted for binding arbitration by a three-member arbitration panel in accordance with the provisions contained herein and the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association (the Arbitration Rules). In arbitration, the Parties will be permitted to conduct reasonable discovery in accordance with the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, and the Arbitration Rules will be deemed to include Fed. R. Civ. P. 26(b), 30, 31, 33, 34, and 36. The Parties involved in arbitration will share equally in the fees and expenses of the arbitration panel. Judgment upon the award rendered by the arbitration panel may be entered in any court having jurisdiction. The arbitration panel will determine all questions of fact and law relating to any controversy, claim, or dispute hereunder, including whether or not any such controversy, claim, or dispute hereunder is subject to the arbitration provisions contained herein. 39 4919-2205-6789.1
(b) Any Party desiring arbitration under this Section 13.2.1 (the Demanding Party) will serve on the other Parties, and the Office of the American Arbitration Association in San Francisco, California, in accordance with the Rules, its demand for arbitration (the Demand), accompanied by the name of the person chosen by the Demanding Party to select an arbitrator with experience in the subject matter of the relevant Dispute. The responding Party or Parties will choose a second person to select an arbitrator with experience in the subject matter of the relevant Dispute, and the two persons so chosen will select the third member of the arbitration panel. All of the arbitrators will be independent and neutral. If the two persons chosen by the Parties cannot agree upon the third member arbitration panel within thirty (30) days after the designation of the second person, the third member of the arbitration panel shall be selected in accordance with the Arbitration Rules. If the responding Party or Parties upon whom the Demand is served fail to advise the Demanding Party of their choice of a person to select the arbitration panel within fifteen (15) days after receipt of the Demand, or if the foregoing arbitration selection procedure fails for any other reason, the arbitrators will be selected in accordance with the Arbitration Rules. The arbitration proceedings provided hereunder are hereby declared to be self-executing, and it will not be necessary to petition a court to compel arbitration. All arbitration proceedings will be held in San Francisco, California. (c) Notice of the Demand will be filed in writing with the other Parties to this Agreement and with the American Arbitration Association. The Demand will be made within a reasonable time after the claim, dispute or other matter in question has arisen, and in no event will it be made after the date when institution or legal or equitable proceedings based on such claim, dispute or other matter in question would be barred by the applicable statutes of limitations. (d) Unless stated otherwise herein, all disputes other than Technical Disputes will be resolved in accordance with the dispute resolution procedures set forth in this Section 13.2.1. Notwithstanding the foregoing, (i) the Parties may at any time seek injunctive relief from a court of competent jurisdiction, and (ii) nothing herein will prevent a Party from defending or pursuing any claim in a court or other proceeding against a third party that has been initiated by such third party. In the event any dispute involves common issues of fact, liability or responsibility with any dispute or controversy under any other agreement (including any Revenue Agreement, any Interconnection Agreement, and other project agreements), each of the Parties agrees, where reasonably justified, may join such disputes and controversies to seek a common resolution of all such matters. 13.2.2 Technical Disputes. (a) Any Dispute which is mutually agreed by the Parties (each acting in its sole discretion) to involve engineering, construction or technical matters as the sole or primary area of disagreement between the Parties shall be deemed to be a Technical Dispute (each, a Technical Dispute) and shall be resolved in accordance with the procedures specified in this Section 13.2.2. (b) Any Technical Dispute shall first be subject to the provisions of Section 13.1 above, and if the Technical Dispute is not resolved by the Parties pursuant thereto, any Party (the Disputing Party) may refer the Technical Dispute for resolution by providing written notice delivered to the other Party or Parties (the Opposing Party) (i) stating the general nature of the 40 4919-2205-6789.1
Technical Dispute, (ii) stating the amount or extent of such Technical Dispute and (iii) attaching supporting data for such Technical Dispute. (c) The Disputing Party and the Opposing Party, acting reasonably and in good faith, shall designate an independent technical expert with a minimum of ten (10) years of experience in the area that is the subject of the dispute to resolve the Technical Dispute (the Technical Dispute Arbitrator). Within five (5) Business Days following receipt of the Disputing Partys notice regarding a Technical Dispute, the Parties shall confer in an effort to agree upon a Technical Dispute Arbitrator. If the Parties are unable to agree upon the appointment of a Technical Dispute Arbitrator, then at the end of such five (5) Business Day period each Party shall, within three (3) Business Days, notify the other Party in writing of its designation of a proposed Technical Dispute Arbitrator. Within three (3) Business Days of each Partys receipt of the proposed Technical Dispute Arbitrator, the two proposed Technical Dispute Arbitrators shall select a qualified independent third party to be the Technical Dispute Arbitrator. (d) The Opposing Party shall submit any response to the Disputing Party and the Technical Dispute Arbitrator within twenty (20) Business Days after receipt of the Disputing Partys last submittal (unless the Technical Dispute Arbitrator allows additional time or the Parties otherwise agree), and the Disputing Party shall submit any reply thereto within ten (10) Business Days of receipt thereof (unless the Technical Dispute Arbitrator allows additional time or the Parties otherwise agree). Each Partys submission shall be in the form of written statements of position by such Party, and each Party shall have the opportunity to respond to the written statements of the other Party and to any requests for statements or information by the Technical Dispute Arbitrator; provided, however, that other than as provided in the immediately preceding sentence, all such submissions by a Party shall be made within five (5) Business Days of receipt of the submission or request to which it responds, and, notwithstanding any provision herein to the contrary, any unresolved disputed items shall be determined by the Technical Dispute Arbitrator within twenty (20) Business Days of receipt by the Technical Dispute Arbitrator of the Parties latest submissions of information. Upon the request of all Parties, the Technical Dispute Arbitrator shall meet jointly with the Parties or their representatives with respect to any such Technical Dispute during such five (5) Business Day period. If the Technical Dispute Arbitrator does not render a formal decision in writing within the time stated in this Section 13.2.2(d), the Parties may initiate an arbitration as set forth in Section 13.2.1 to resolve the Dispute. (e) If the amount in controversy is equal to or greater than $30,000, the decision of the Technical Dispute Arbitrator shall not be final and binding. With respect to such Technical Disputes, if any Party is dissatisfied with the decision of the Technical Dispute Arbitrator, such Party may initiate arbitration proceedings as set forth in Section 13.2.1; provided, however, that the written decision of the Technical Dispute Arbitrator shall be admissible in evidence in any such arbitration. If the amount in controversy is less than $30,000, then the decision of the Technical Dispute Arbitrator shall be final and binding on the Parties. (f) Either Party (i) may provide reports and information prepared by a third party engineer or expert of its choice in connection with the written notice under Section 13.2.2(b), the submissions under Section 13.2.2(d), and in responding to any requests by the Technical Dispute Arbitrator, and (ii) may provide any such other evidence as it considers relevant provided that such evidence and the presentation thereof complies with any Arbitration Rules that relate to 41 4919-2205-6789.1
such matters. The Technical Dispute Arbitrator shall provide his or her decision in the form of a written, reasoned opinion. The Technical Dispute Arbitrator shall not be personally liable to any Party in connection with any interpretation or decision rendered in good faith in such capacity. All costs of the Technical Dispute Arbitrator shall be borne by the Party whose position in the Dispute is not supported by the decision of the Technical Dispute Arbitrator unless the decision of the Technical Dispute Arbitrator does not clearly support one Partys position, in which event such costs shall be borne by the Parties involved in such Dispute in their Proportionate Shares in the Shared Facilities. 13.2.3 Filing Deadlines. The Parties agree that arbitration pursuant to Sections 13.2.1 and 13.2.2 must be initiated within a reasonable time after the claim, dispute or other matter in question has arisen, and in no event shall it be made after the date when institution of legal or equitable proceedings based on such claim, dispute or other matter in question would be barred by the applicable statutes of limitations. ARTICLE 14 GENERAL PROVISIONS 14.1 Notices. Any notice required or authorized to be given hereunder or any other communications between the Parties shall be in writing (unless otherwise provided) and shall be served personally or by reputable express courier service to the relevant Party at the address stated below or at any other address notified by that Party to the other as its address for service. Any notice so given personally shall be deemed to have been served on delivery, as evidenced by a receipt acknowledging personal service. Any notice given by express courier service shall be deemed to have been served upon the date of delivery to the address of the recipient, as demonstrated by the receipt of the express courier company certifying delivery to showing the correct address of the addressee. Any notice given by e-mail shall be deemed to have been served upon the date of delivery to the address of the recipient, as demonstrated by an electronic read receipt certifying delivery to the correct e-mail address of the addressee, provided on condition that such e-mail contain the following text in all capitalized letters in the Subject line: OFFICIAL NOTICE UNDER SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT CLARK COUNTY, NV. Any notice delivered after 5:00 p.m. at the delivery location and any notice delivered on a day that is not a Business Day at the delivery location shall not be deemed delivered until the next Business Day.
